original: @75b * // lung ston pa ka l'a p'i mdo'i 'grel pa slob ma la phan pa zhes bya ba bzhugs so //
analyzed: @75b * // lung ston pa ka l'a p'i mdo'i 'grel pa slob ma la phan pa zhes bya ba bzhugs so //
translated: The Commentary on the Kalāpa Sūtra called the Benefit for Disciples

original: # // rje btsun 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug thugs rje chen po can la phyag tshal lo //
analyzed: # // rje btsun 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug thugs rje chen po can la phyag tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the noble Avalokiteśvara, the one with great compassion.

original: sgra rjes su bstan pa 'di la /
analyzed: sgra rjes su bstan pa 'di la /
translated: In this teaching on sounds,

original: yi ge yang dag par brjod pa nye bar bstan pa dad por bya dgos na ;
analyzed: yi ge yang dag par brjod pa nye bar bstan pa dad por bya dgos na ;
translated: the presentation of the correct pronunciation of the letters should be done.

original: de la ji ltar 'di ma byas zhes dogs par byas pa na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar 'di ma byas zhes dogs par byas pa na /
translated: If one wonders how this has not been done,

original: mdo 'di slob dpon gyis mdzad de /
analyzed: mdo 'di slob dpon gyis mdzad de /
translated: this sūtra was composed by the master.

original: grub pa yi ge yang dag par brjod pa'o //
analyzed: grub pa yi ge yang dag par brjod pa'o //
translated: The accomplishment is the correct pronunciation of the letters.

original: aa yig la sogs pa'i yi ge rnams kyi gang yang dag par brjod pa ni rim pas klog pa ste /
analyzed: aa yig la sogs pa'i yi ge rnams kyi gang yang dag par brjod pa ni rim pas klog pa ste /
translated: The correct pronunciation of the letters beginning with a is reading in sequence.

original: de ni grub cing 'jig rten du rab tu grags so zhes pas de nye bar bstan pas ci bya /
analyzed: de ni grub cing 'jig rten du rab tu grags so zhes pas de nye bar bstan pas ci bya /
translated: Since that is accomplished and well-known in the world, what is the use of presenting it?

original: de la dang po bcu bzhi rnams dbyangs rnams so //
analyzed: de la dang po bcu bzhi rnams dbyangs rnams so //
translated: In that, the first fourteen are the vowels.

original: de la zhes pa ni dang po la a'i gcig gi tshig phyis pa'i mi zad pa'o //
analyzed: de la zhes pa ni dang po la a'i gcig gi tshig phyis pa'i mi zad pa'o //
translated: In that means that after removing the one word ā from the beginning, it is inexhaustible.

original: bzhi rnams dang bcu rnams yin pa de rnams ni bcu bzhi rnams so //
analyzed: bzhi rnams dang bcu rnams yin pa de rnams ni bcu bzhi rnams so //
translated: The four and the ten are the fourteen.

original: rab tu grags pa'i yi ge yang dag par brjod pa de la dang por gang yi ge bcu bzhi po de rnams ni dbyangs kyi ming can rnams su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rab tu grags pa'i yi ge yang dag par brjod pa de la dang por gang yi ge bcu bzhi po de rnams ni dbyangs kyi ming can rnams su 'gyur ro //
translated: In that correct pronunciation of the well-known letters, first of all those fourteen letters become those having the name vowels.

original: aa a'a ai a'i au ri r'i li l'i ae aee ao aoo'o //
analyzed: aa a'a ai a'i au ri r'i li l'i ae aee ao aoo'o //
translated: A ā i ī u ū ri rī li lī ai aē au aō.

original: dbyang kyi ming gang du dgos she na /
analyzed: dbyang kyi ming gang du dgos she na /
translated: Where is the name of the vowel needed?

original: ra'i ra la dbyi zhing dbyang snga ma'ang ring po'o zhes pa la sogs pa rnams su'o /
analyzed: ra'i ra la dbyi zhing dbyang snga ma'ang ring po'o zhes pa la sogs pa rnams su'o /
translated: In such [rules] as ra la yi, the previous vowel is long.

original: aagn'i raksha ti /
analyzed: aagn'i raksha ti /
translated: Agnair rakṣati.

original: yi ge yang dag par brjod pa /
analyzed: yi ge yang dag par brjod pa /
translated: Correct pronunciation of the letters.

original: phyi ma la rjes su 'jug pa'i don du de la zhes smos so //
analyzed: phyi ma la rjes su 'jug pa'i don du de la zhes smos so //
translated: In that [rule], 'that' is stated for the purpose of applying to the following.

original: bcu rnams mtshungs pa'o //
analyzed: bcu rnams mtshungs pa'o //
translated: The ten are the same.

original: dang por zhes pa rjes su 'jug go //
analyzed: dang por zhes pa rjes su 'jug go //
translated: First is applied.

original: yi ge yang dag par brjod pa de la dang por yi ge bcu gang yin pa de mtshungs pa'i ming can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yi ge yang dag par brjod pa de la dang por yi ge bcu gang yin pa de mtshungs pa'i ming can du 'gyur ro //
translated: In that correct pronunciation of the letters, first of all those ten letters become those having the name same.

original: aa a'a ai a'i au a'u ri r'i li l'i'o //
analyzed: aa a'a ai a'i au a'u ri r'i li l'i'o //
translated: A ā i ī u ū ri rī li lī ai aē au aō.

original: mtshungs p'i ming gang du dgos she na /
analyzed: mtshungs p'i ming gang du dgos she na /
translated: What is the need for a name that is similar?

original: mtshungs pa 'dra ba'i yi ge la zhes pa rnams su'o //
analyzed: mtshungs pa 'dra ba'i yi ge la zhes pa rnams su'o //
translated: The need is for similar, that is, similar letters.

original: r'a m'a ya ta nam /
analyzed: r'a m'a ya ta nam /
translated: The letters ra, ma, ya, ta, and na

original: de rnams kyi gnyis gnyis dag phan tshun gyi 'dra ba'i yi ge dag go //
analyzed: de rnams kyi gnyis gnyis dag phan tshun gyi 'dra ba'i yi ge dag go //
translated: are the similar letters of those two pairs.

original: gnyis gnyis dag ces pa ni tshig gcig yin te /
analyzed: gnyis gnyis dag ces pa ni tshig gcig yin te /
translated: The two pairs is one word.

original: yang yang la nam yang na ste tshig gnyis so zhes gsungs pa'i phyir gnyis dag ces pa 'di lan gnyis brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: yang yang la nam yang na ste tshig gnyis so zhes gsungs pa'i phyir gnyis dag ces pa 'di lan gnyis brjod par bya'o //
translated: Since it is said that the two words are again and again, or ever, the two pairs should be repeated.

original: mtshungs pa bcu po de rnams kyi mtshungs pa gnyis gnyis gang yin pa de dag phan tshun te gcig gi gcig 'dra ba'i yi ge'i ming can dag tu 'gyur ro /
analyzed: mtshungs pa bcu po de rnams kyi mtshungs pa gnyis gnyis gang yin pa de dag phan tshun te gcig gi gcig 'dra ba'i yi ge'i ming can dag tu 'gyur ro /
translated: Those two pairs are the similar letters of each other, that is, they are the similar letters of one another.

original: @76a * // aa yig gi a'a yig 'dra ba'i yi ge dang / a'a yig gi aa yig 'dra ba'i yi ge ste /
analyzed: @76a * // aa yig gi a'a yig 'dra ba'i yi ge dang / a'a yig gi aa yig 'dra ba'i yi ge ste /
translated: The letter a is the similar letter of the letter ā, and the letter ā is the similar letter of the letter a.

original: de bzhin du thams cad du'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du thams cad du'o //
translated: This is so in all cases.

original: 'dra ba'i yi ge'i ming gang du dgos she na /
analyzed: 'dra ba'i yi ge'i ming gang du dgos she na /
translated: What is the need for a name that is a similar letter?

original: mtshungs pa 'dra ba'i yi ge la zhes pa la sogs pa rnams su'o //
analyzed: mtshungs pa 'dra ba'i yi ge la zhes pa la sogs pa rnams su'o //
translated: The similar letters are those beginning with ya.

original: ru dra yuddham /
analyzed: ru dra yuddham /
translated: Rudra yudhaṃ

original: krishn'a gram / g'am g'a ya ta nam /
analyzed: krishn'a gram / g'am g'a ya ta nam /
translated: kṛṣṇāgraṃ

original: 'o na rjes su 'jug bzhin pa'i thung ba dang ring ba dag la 'di'i ming du bya ba yin na /
analyzed: 'o na rjes su 'jug bzhin pa'i thung ba dang ring ba dag la 'di'i ming du bya ba yin na /
translated: If the short and long vowels that are being inflected are the name of this [letter],

original: de ji ltar thung du gnyis dag gi dang ring ba gnyis dag gir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar thung du gnyis dag gi dang ring ba gnyis dag gir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: how is it that there are two short ones and two long ones?

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: It is said:

original: san la tsva ni ti zhes pa dang / gsum pa sogs la ni pa r'a di'i zhes pas shes par byed pa 'di las 'gyur ro //
analyzed: san la tsva ni ti zhes pa dang / gsum pa sogs la ni pa r'a di'i zhes pas shes par byed pa 'di las 'gyur ro //
translated: The third and so on are known by the word parādi.

original: sde ba la sde pa'i 'dra ba'i yi ge'o zhes pa'i tshig las gsal byed rnams kyi yang 'dra ba'i yi ge'i ming can no //
analyzed: sde ba la sde pa'i 'dra ba'i yi ge'o zhes pa'i tshig las gsal byed rnams kyi yang 'dra ba'i yi ge'i ming can no //
translated: From the words the similar letters of the class are the class, it is clear that the similar letters are also the names of the consonants.

original: des na ka kha ga gha nga zhes pa 'di rnams kyi phan tshun du 'dra ba'i yi ge'i ming can te /
analyzed: des na ka kha ga gha nga zhes pa 'di rnams kyi phan tshun du 'dra ba'i yi ge'i ming can te /
translated: Therefore, these ka kha ga gha ṅa have the name of similar letters in mutual [relation].

original: de bzhin du gzhan rnams kyi 'ang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan rnams kyi 'ang ngo //
translated: So do the others.

original: ri yig dang li yig dag 'dra ba'i yi ge'i ming can du'ang brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: ri yig dang li yig dag 'dra ba'i yi ge'i ming can du'ang brjod par bya ste /
translated: The letters ri and li are also called similar letters.🔽Hotrilika

original: ho tri li k'a ra /🔽ho tri k'a ra /
analyzed: ho tri li k'a ra / ho tri k'a ra /
translated: Hotrika

original: mtshungs pa 'dra ba'i yi ge la zhes pas ring po'o //
analyzed: mtshungs pa 'dra ba'i yi ge la zhes pas ring po'o //
translated: The letter similar to a long one is a long one.

original: snga ma thung ngu'o //🔽'dra ba'i yi ge dag gi gang snga ma de thung du'i ming can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snga ma thung ngu'o // 'dra ba'i yi ge dag gi gang snga ma de thung du'i ming can du 'gyur ro //
translated: The former is a short one.🔽The letter similar to the former is a short one.

original: aa ai au ri li'o //
analyzed: aa ai au ri li'o //
translated: The short ones are a, i, u, r, and l.

original: thung ngu'i ming gang du dgos she na /
analyzed: thung ngu'i ming gang du dgos she na /

original: ma'i don rnams kyi thung ngu'o zhes pa la sogs pa rnams su'o //
analyzed: ma'i don rnams kyi thung ngu'o zhes pa la sogs pa rnams su'o //
translated: In the meanings of ma, in the words such as “the short one” and so on.

original: he aamba / snga ma ni yang ba'i ming can du'ang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: he aamba / snga ma ni yang ba'i ming can du'ang brjod par bya'o //
translated: The former is also called a light one.

original: de gang du dgos she na /
analyzed: de gang du dgos she na /
translated: Where is the need for that?

original: au pa dh'a n'a mina'i'ang yang pa'i zhes pa la sogs pa rnams su'o //
analyzed: au pa dh'a n'a mina'i'ang yang pa'i zhes pa la sogs pa rnams su'o //
translated: In the words such as “the light one” in the words “the light of the moon” and so on.

original: be da t'i /
analyzed: be da t'i /
translated: Vedati

original: bi da shes pa la'o //🔽shvasta n'i'i t'a ste aita'o //
analyzed: bi da shes pa la'o // shvasta n'i'i t'a ste aita'o //
translated: Veda means to know.🔽Svastanaiti means it goes.

original: au pa dh'a n'a mina'i zhes pas yon tan to //
analyzed: au pa dh'a n'a mina'i zhes pas yon tan to //
translated: Upadhanamin means quality.

original: phyi ma ring po'o //
analyzed: phyi ma ring po'o //
translated: The latter is a long one.

original: 'dra ba'i yi ge dag gi gang phyi ma de ring po'i ming can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dra ba'i yi ge dag gi gang phyi ma de ring po'i ming can du 'gyur ro //

original: a'a a'i a'u r'i l'i'o //
analyzed: a'a a'i a'u r'i l'i'o //
translated: The long ones are ā, ā, ā, ā, ā, ā, ā, ā, ā, ā.

original: ring po'i ming gang du dgos she na /
analyzed: ring po'i ming gang du dgos she na /

original: aa yig sgra ldan la ring po'o zhes pa la sogs pa rnams su'o //
analyzed: aa yig sgra ldan la ring po'o zhes pa la sogs pa rnams su'o //
translated: In such passages as “The long ā is for the sound of a.”

original: ru dr'a ya /
analyzed: ru dr'a ya /
translated: Rudrāya.

original: phyi ma ni lci ba'i ming can du yang brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: phyi ma ni lci ba'i ming can du yang brjod par bya ste /
translated: The latter should also be called the name of the heavy one.

original: de gang du dgos she na /
analyzed: de gang du dgos she na /
translated: Where is that needed?

original: lci ba las kyang nashthi la zhes pa la sogs pa rnams su'o //
analyzed: lci ba las kyang nashthi la zhes pa la sogs pa rnams su'o //
translated: In such passages as “The heavy one is also for the sound of a.”🔽The ā is for the sound of ha.

original: tshig med na 'phen pa tsam las ming dang ming can gyi mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa dmigs pa min no zhes pas sbyor ba brtsams so //
analyzed: tshig med na 'phen pa tsam las ming dang ming can gyi mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa dmigs pa min no zhes pas sbyor ba brtsams so //
translated: If there were no words, there would be no more than a mere projection, and the relation between the name and the thing named would not be perceived.

original: aa'i yi ge bor ba'i dbyangs ni n'a mina'o //
analyzed: aa'i yi ge bor ba'i dbyangs ni n'a mina'o //
translated: The vowel of the letter a is na.

original: bri dzi las tsu ra la sogs pa nyid kyi phyir aina'o //
analyzed: bri dzi las tsu ra la sogs pa nyid kyi phyir aina'o //
translated: The vowel of the letter i is in, because it is the same as cu ra and so on.🔽The vowel of the letter u is u, because it is the same as u.🔽The vowel of the letter e is ai, because it is the same as ai.🔽The vowel of the letter o is au, because it is the same as au.🔽The vowel of the letter a is la, because it is the same as la.🔽The vowel of the letter a is ra, because it is the same as ra.🔽The vowel of the letter a is ha, because it is the same as ha.

original: bor ba nyid do zhes pas bor ba'o //
analyzed: bor ba nyid do zhes pas bor ba'o //
translated: The vowel of the letter a is ksa, because it is the same as ksa.🔽The vowel of the letter a is sa, because it is the same as sa.🔽The vowel of the letter a is sa, because it is the same as sa.

original: dbyangs dang bri tri li gra ha rnams kyi aa la'o //🔽ka r'i ta dbyi'o //
analyzed: dbyangs dang bri tri li gra ha rnams kyi aa la'o // ka r'i ta dbyi'o //
translated: The vowel of the letter a is ha, because it is the same as ha.

original: dbyangs gang la aa yig bor ba zhes tshig rnam par sbyor ro //
analyzed: dbyangs gang la aa yig bor ba zhes tshig rnam par sbyor ro //
translated: The vowel of the letter a is ksa, because it is the same as ksa.🔽The vowel of the letter a is sa, because it is the same as sa.🔽The vowel of the letter a is sa, because it is the same as sa.

original: aa'i yi ge ni aa yig dang a'a yig dag ste dbyangs ni 'dra ba'i yi ge 'dzin par byed pa'o zhes pa'i tshig las so //🔽de ltar na yi ge smos pas thams cad du gnyis dag 'dzin no //🔽aa'i yi ge bor ba'i dbyangs ni n'a mina'i ming can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: aa'i yi ge ni aa yig dang a'a yig dag ste dbyangs ni 'dra ba'i yi ge 'dzin par byed pa'o zhes pa'i tshig las so // de ltar na yi ge smos pas thams cad du gnyis dag 'dzin no // aa'i yi ge bor ba'i dbyangs ni n'a mina'i ming can du 'gyur ro //
translated: The vowel of the letter a is ha, because it is the same as ha.🔽The vowel of the letter a is ksa, because it is the same as ksa.🔽The vowel of the letter a is sa, because it is the same as sa.🔽The vowel of the letter a is sa, because it is the same as sa.🔽The vowel of the letter a is ha, because it is the same as ha.🔽The vowel of the letter a is ksa, because it is the same as ksa.

original: ai a'i au a'u ri r'i li li ae aee ao aoo'o //
analyzed: ai a'i au a'u ri r'i li li ae aee ao aoo'o //
translated: The vowel of the letter a is sa, because it is the same as sa.🔽The vowel of the letter a is sa, because it is the same as sa.🔽The vowel of the letter a is ha, because it is the same as ha.🔽The vowel of the letter a is ksa, because it is the same as ksa.🔽The vowel of the letter a is sa, because it is the same as sa.🔽The vowel of the letter a

original: n'a mina'i ming gang du dgos she na /
analyzed: n'a mina'i ming gang du dgos she na /
translated: Where is the name of nāminī needed?

original: n'a min las dbyangs la'o /
analyzed: n'a min las dbyangs la'o /
translated: From nāminī, for a vowel.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa rnams su'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa rnams su'o //
translated: And so on.

original: da dhi n'i /
analyzed: da dhi n'i /
translated: Dādhinī.

original: ae yig la sogs pa rnams mtshams sbyor gyi yi ge rnams so //🔽yi ge gang rnams kyi dang po ae yig yin pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: ae yig la sogs pa rnams mtshams sbyor gyi yi ge rnams so // yi ge gang rnams kyi dang po ae yig yin pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The letters beginning with e are the connecting letters.🔽The letters of which the first is the letter e, the words are to be connected.

original: ae yig la sogs pa'i yi ge rnams mtshams sbyor gyi yi ge'i ming can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ae yig la sogs pa'i yi ge rnams mtshams sbyor gyi yi ge'i ming can du 'gyur ro //
translated: The letters beginning with e are called the connecting letters.

original: ae aee ao aoo'o //
analyzed: ae aee ao aoo'o //
translated: E, ai, o, au.

original: mtshams sbyor gyi yi ge'i ming gang du dgos zhe na /
analyzed: mtshams sbyor gyi yi ge'i ming gang du dgos zhe na /
translated: Where is the name of the connecting letters needed?

original: mtshams sbyor gyi yi ge'i mtha' rnams kyi aa'o zhes pa la sogs pa rnams su'o //
analyzed: mtshams sbyor gyi yi ge'i mtha' rnams kyi aa'o zhes pa la sogs pa rnams su'o //
translated: At the ends of the connecting letters, āu and so on.🔽Dādhatī.

original: d'a t'a / deng bsrung ba la'o //
analyzed: d'a t'a / deng bsrung ba la'o //
translated: Today, for protection.

original: ming bzhi po 'di rnams kyi ste dbyangs smos pa rjes su 'jug pa'i ched du'o //
analyzed: ming bzhi po 'di rnams kyi ste dbyangs smos pa rjes su 'jug pa'i ched du'o //
translated: These four names, the vowels are mentioned for the purpose of inclusion.

original: 'o na nye bar mtshon par byed pa nyid kyi phyir ae yig gi ming ci ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na nye bar mtshon par byed pa nyid kyi phyir ae yig gi ming ci ltar yin zhe na /
translated: Well then, why is the letter e called a name, since it is an indicator?

original: bden mod / h'a w'a ma'i zhes pa 'dir hve nya'i mtshams sbyor gyi yi ge'i mtha' can rnams kyi aa yig go zhes pas a'a nyid byas pa'i phyir 'gyur ro //🔽ka la sogs pa rnams gsal byed do //
analyzed: bden mod / h'a w'a ma'i zhes pa 'dir hve nya'i mtshams sbyor gyi yi ge'i mtha' can rnams kyi aa yig go zhes pas a'a nyid byas pa'i phyir 'gyur ro // ka la sogs pa rnams gsal byed do //
translated: ha, so it is made ā.🔽The ka and so on are the consonants.

original: ka yig la sogs pa'i yi ge rnams gsal byed kyi ming can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ka yig la sogs pa'i yi ge rnams gsal byed kyi ming can du 'gyur ro //
translated: The letters ka and so on become the names of the consonants.

original: ka kha ga gha nga /
analyzed: ka kha ga gha nga /
translated: Ka kha ga gha ṅa.

original: dzny'a na buddha zhes pa kvi pa'i mtha' can 'di'i tshig mtha' la dhut rnams kyi zhes pas dha yig gi dang po 'gyur ro //🔽gal te de lta na don smos par bya'i /
analyzed: dzny'a na buddha zhes pa kvi pa'i mtha' can 'di'i tshig mtha' la dhut rnams kyi zhes pas dha yig gi dang po 'gyur ro // gal te de lta na don smos par bya'i /
translated: The word jñānabuddho, which ends in -i, has the first of the dhas, because of the words among the dhas of the endings of the words.

original: nye bar dmigs pa smos pa ni don med pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: nye bar dmigs pa smos pa ni don med pa'o zhe na /
translated: If it is so, then the meaning should be stated, but the statement of upalabdhi is meaningless.

original: smras pa / gang du snga ma dang pha rol dag med cing don nye par dmigs pa der yang tshig gi ming ji lta ba bzhin du 'gyur ro zhes nye bar dmigs pa smos so //
analyzed: smras pa / gang du snga ma dang pha rol dag med cing don nye par dmigs pa der yang tshig gi ming ji lta ba bzhin du 'gyur ro zhes nye bar dmigs pa smos so //
translated: It is said: Where there is no previous and subsequent, and the meaning is perceived nearby, there also the word is as the name is. Thus upalabdhi is stated.

original: @78b des na /
analyzed: @78b des na /
translated: By that,

original: bya ti se /
analyzed: bya ti se /
translated: byati,

original: da dhi zhes pa la sogs pa la tshig nyid du grub po //
analyzed: da dhi zhes pa la sogs pa la tshig nyid du grub po //
translated: and so on, the word itself is established.

original: bya ti snga ma can gyi aa sti las se'i rkyen no //
analyzed: bya ti snga ma can gyi aa sti las se'i rkyen no //
translated: From the previous byati, the ending -ti is due to the condition of asti.

original: aast'i dang po'i zhes pas aa yig dbyi'o //
analyzed: aast'i dang po'i zhes pas aa yig dbyi'o //
translated: Of asti, the first means the letter a.

original: aa sti'i si la'o zhes bas sa dbyi'o //
analyzed: aa sti'i si la'o zhes bas sa dbyi'o //
translated: By of asti, the si, the letter s is elided.

original: da dhi zhes pa 'di la ma ning las si aam dag gi zhes pas si dbyi'o //
analyzed: da dhi zhes pa 'di la ma ning las si aam dag gi zhes pas si dbyi'o //
translated: In this dadhi, by of the anusvāra, the si and am, the letter s is elided.

original: rim pa bsam 'das par phral bar bya'o //
analyzed: rim pa bsam 'das par phral bar bya'o //
translated: It should be analyzed beyond thought.

original: aa ti snga ma can gyi kra mi las 'da' ba nyid do zhes dngos po la gha nya'o //
analyzed: aa ti snga ma can gyi kra mi las 'da' ba nyid do zhes dngos po la gha nya'o //
translated: The preceding a is elided by the rule atikrāmati.

original: ait dang bcas pa aal mtha'i zhes pas ai tsa dang 'dra bar 'gyar ba bkag pa'i phyir ring por mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ait dang bcas pa aal mtha'i zhes pas ai tsa dang 'dra bar 'gyar ba bkag pa'i phyir ring por mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The long vowel is not elided by the rule itadvat, because it is like ica.

original: de nas 'da' bar mi byed do zhes pas byings don la ain te k'a ri ta'o zhes pas ain no //
analyzed: de nas 'da' bar mi byed do zhes pas byings don la ain te k'a ri ta'o zhes pas ain no //
translated: Then, the rule na atikrāmati is applied, and the root has the meaning of iñ.

original: ain la rtags kyi zhes pas aa yig dbyi'o //
analyzed: ain la rtags kyi zhes pas aa yig dbyi'o //
translated: The iñ is elided by the rule liṅ.

original: de nas da ltar pa la shantring dang a'a na sha dag go zhes pa shatringa'o //
analyzed: de nas da ltar pa la shantring dang a'a na sha dag go zhes pa shatringa'o //
translated: Then, the present tense is formed with śan and āna.

original: aan bi ka ra na'o //
analyzed: aan bi ka ra na'o //
translated: The iñ is elided by the rule anvikarana.

original: yon tan no //🔽aa dang mtshams sbyor gyi yi ge zhes pas aa dbyi'o //
analyzed: yon tan no // aa dang mtshams sbyor gyi yi ge zhes pas aa dbyi'o //
translated: The iñ is elided by the rule guṇa.🔽The a is elided by the rule anubandha.

original: gsal byed las kyang ngo zhes pas si dbyi'o //🔽brtsegs pa'i mtha'i dbyi'o //
analyzed: gsal byed las kyang ngo zhes pas si dbyi'o // brtsegs pa'i mtha'i dbyi'o //
translated: The s is elided by the rule varṇa.🔽The final is elided by the rule piṇḍa.

original: bi sngon ma can sh'i sha las phral ba nyid do zhes pas dngos po la gha nya'o //
analyzed: bi sngon ma can sh'i sha las phral ba nyid do zhes pas dngos po la gha nya'o //
translated: The preceding a is elided by the rule viśeṣaṇa.

original: de nas phral par bya'o zhes pas snga ma bzhin aina'o //
analyzed: de nas phral par bya'o zhes pas snga ma bzhin aina'o //
translated: Then, the preceding is elided by the rule as before.

original: sapta mi'a'i y'a t'o //
analyzed: sapta mi'a'i y'a t'o //
translated: sapta māyāt |

original: aan bi ka ra na'o //
analyzed: aan bi ka ra na'o //
translated: anvikaranaḥ |

original: yon tan to //🔽y'a sgra'i zhes pas ai nyid do //
analyzed: yon tan to // y'a sgra'i zhes pas ai nyid do //
translated: guṇat |🔽yā sargāt |

original: 'di ni yongs su bshad pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni yongs su bshad pa'o //
translated: This is the explanation.

original: yi ge gcig tu sbyar ba rnams kyi rin pa 'das shing 'khrul par mi byed par phral bar bya ste /
analyzed: yi ge gcig tu sbyar ba rnams kyi rin pa 'das shing 'khrul par mi byed par phral bar bya ste /
translated: The price of those who apply a single letter should be taken away and it should be separated without error.

original: rim pa gang kho nas yi ge sbyar pa de kho nas phral bar bya'o zhes yongs su bshad par bya'o //🔽da dhi aa tra /
analyzed: rim pa gang kho nas yi ge sbyar pa de kho nas phral bar bya'o zhes yongs su bshad par bya'o // da dhi aa tra /
translated: By whatever sequence the letter is applied, by that very sequence it should be separated. This is the explanation.🔽dadhi atra |

original: da dhya tra /
analyzed: da dhya tra /
translated: dadhyatra |

original: dhi yig las ai yig phral bar bya ste snga mar ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dhi yig las ai yig phral bar bya ste snga mar ni ma yin no //
translated: The letter dhi should be separated from the letter i, not from the previous one.

original: byis pa rnams kyi rmongs pa bzog pa'i don du brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: byis pa rnams kyi rmongs pa bzog pa'i don du brjod pa yin no //
translated: This is stated for the purpose of dispelling the confusion of the ignorant.

original: gsal byed dbyangs med pa pha rol gyi yi ger drang ngo //
analyzed: gsal byed dbyangs med pa pha rol gyi yi ger drang ngo //
translated: The consonants without vowels should be taken as the following letters.

original: tshig dang po bzhi ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: tshig dang po bzhi ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: The first four words are the second.

original: 'di ni sgrub pa'i don no //
analyzed: 'di ni sgrub pa'i don no //
translated: This is the meaning of accomplishment.

original: gsal byed gang dbyangs med pa de pha rol gyi yi ger drang bar bya'o //
analyzed: gsal byed gang dbyangs med pa de pha rol gyi yi ger drang bar bya'o //
translated: Any consonant without a vowel should be taken as the following letter.

original: tva mat / mchu dang nye ba can dang lce rtsa can dag la gsal byed kyi ming yod pa ma yin na'ang pha rol du drang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: tva mat / mchu dang nye ba can dang lce rtsa can dag la gsal byed kyi ming yod pa ma yin na'ang pha rol du drang bar 'gyur te /
translated: tvaṃ mataḥ |

original: pa wa wa: dang / she sh'a thkrarma /
analyzed: pa wa wa: dang / she sh'a thkrarma /
translated: pavaṃvaḥ, śeṣā thakramaḥ

original: byed par zhes pa'i shes par byed pa las so //
analyzed: byed par zhes pa'i shes par byed pa las so //
translated: kṛtvā iti kṛtyāt |

original: 'jig rten gyi nye bar spyod pa las 'dzin pa grub po //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi nye bar spyod pa las 'dzin pa grub po //
translated: grahaṇaṃ siddhaṃ lokānuvṛttyā |

original: 'jig rten rnams ni sdon gyi slob dpon rnams so //
analyzed: 'jig rten rnams ni sdon gyi slob dpon rnams so //
translated: lokaḥ pūrvācāryāḥ |

original: @79a * // nye bar spyod par byed cing gang gis tha snyad du byed do zhes pa nye bar spyod pa ste bstan pa 'chos so //
analyzed: @79a * // nye bar spyod par byed cing gang gis tha snyad du byed do zhes pa nye bar spyod pa ste bstan pa 'chos so //
translated: lokaṃ anu vartate yena saṃketam karoti sa lokānuvṛttiḥ śāstraṃ kurvan |

original: gsal byed las kyang ngo zhes pas gha nya'o //
analyzed: gsal byed las kyang ngo zhes pas gha nya'o //
translated: kṛtyād api ghaṇā |🔽vṛddhiḥ |

original: 'phel ba'o // 'jig rten rnams kyi nye bar spyod pa ni 'jig rten nye bar spyod pa'o //
analyzed: 'phel ba'o // 'jig rten rnams kyi nye bar spyod pa ni 'jig rten nye bar spyod pa'o //
translated: lokasya anu vṛttiḥ lokānuvṛttiḥ |

original: gzung bar bya'o zhes pa 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: gzung bar bya'o zhes pa 'dzin pa'o //
translated: grahaṇaṃ grahaḥ |

original: kri tya dang auta rnams gzhan du yang ngo zhes pa yuta'o //
analyzed: kri tya dang auta rnams gzhan du yang ngo zhes pa yuta'o //
translated: kṛtyotārau paratra api yutāḥ |

original: ma brjod pa'i bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i nye bar spyod pa ste /
analyzed: ma brjod pa'i bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i nye bar spyod pa ste /
translated: The unexpressed action is worldly usage.

original: sngon gyi slob dpon gyi bstan bcos las 'dzin par grub cing 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngon gyi slob dpon gyi bstan bcos las 'dzin par grub cing 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: The former masters have taught that it is established and will be established by the treatise.

original: 'jig pa dang dbyi ba dang plu ta la sogs pa rnams 'jig rten gyi nye bar spyod pa las rjes su rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig pa dang dbyi ba dang plu ta la sogs pa rnams 'jig rten gyi nye bar spyod pa las rjes su rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The destruction, removal, and so on of the afflictions should be understood from worldly usage.

original: gang la shes byed sbyor ba 'thad pa la sogs pas kyang 'grub pa de la ni 'jig rten gyi nye bar spyod pa gzung bas ci bya /
analyzed: gang la shes byed sbyor ba 'thad pa la sogs pas kyang 'grub pa de la ni 'jig rten gyi nye bar spyod pa gzung bas ci bya /
translated: What is established by the application of the proof of tenability and so on, what is the use of accepting it from worldly usage?

original: jo bo drag 'byor gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa slob ma la phan par mtshams sbyor dang po rdzogs so /
analyzed: jo bo drag 'byor gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa slob ma la phan par mtshams sbyor dang po rdzogs so /
translated: The first chapter of the commentary composed by the venerable master Jayananda, which is beneficial for students, is complete.

original: // / mtshungs pa 'dra ba'i yi ge la ring por 'gyur te pha rol yang dbyi'o //
analyzed: // / mtshungs pa 'dra ba'i yi ge la ring por 'gyur te pha rol yang dbyi'o //
translated: The long vowel is formed from a similar letter, and the final is also pronounced.

original: d'irghvi zhes pa mi zad pa ste dang po'i gcig gi tshig phyis pa'o //
analyzed: d'irghvi zhes pa mi zad pa ste dang po'i gcig gi tshig phyis pa'o //
translated: Dīrgha means inexhaustible, and the word for first is elided.

original: ring po ma yin pa ring por 'gyur ba'o zhes pas a'a khya ta las kyang ta ma sogs rnams so zhes pas rtsvi'o //
analyzed: ring po ma yin pa ring por 'gyur ba'o zhes pas a'a khya ta las kyang ta ma sogs rnams so zhes pas rtsvi'o //
translated: Thus, from ākhaṇḍa, taṃ, etc.

original: nges par bstan pa 'di nyid kyi shugs las tsvi pha rol la a'i yi ge'i a'i nyd de tsvi dbyi ba yang ngo //
analyzed: nges par bstan pa 'di nyid kyi shugs las tsvi pha rol la a'i yi ge'i a'i nyd de tsvi dbyi ba yang ngo //
translated: This very teaching implies that the ā of ākhaṇḍa is elided, and the ā of ākhaṇḍa is elided.

original: mtshungs pa 'dr ba'i yi ge pha rol la ring por 'gyur te pha rol yang dbyi bar 'gyur ro /
analyzed: mtshungs pa 'dr ba'i yi ge pha rol la ring por 'gyur te pha rol yang dbyi bar 'gyur ro /
translated: The long one is the long one of the similar one. The long one is also elided.

original: m'a sh'a dha kam /
analyzed: m'a sh'a dha kam /
translated: mā śādhakam

original: da dhi ha te /
analyzed: da dhi ha te /
translated: dad dhite

original: ma dh'u ha nam /
analyzed: ma dh'u ha nam /
translated: madhū hanam🔽ho triśi

original: ho tri shi: 'dra ba'i yi ge la zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: ho tri shi: 'dra ba'i yi ge la zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: The similar letter is the similar one. What is it?

original: ma dhv na ya /
analyzed: ma dhv na ya /
translated: madhvānayi

original: li yig ni ring por byas pa rab tu sbyor ba med pa'i phyir dper brjod med do //
analyzed: li yig ni ring por byas pa rab tu sbyor ba med pa'i phyir dper brjod med do //
translated: The long li is not used, so there is no example.

original: 'o na 'dra ba'i yi ge la ring po ni mtshungs pa kho na la srid do zhes pas mtshungs pa smos ci dgos she na /
analyzed: 'o na 'dra ba'i yi ge la ring po ni mtshungs pa kho na la srid do zhes pas mtshungs pa smos ci dgos she na /
translated: Well then, the long of the similar letter is possible only for the similar one, so why mention the similar one?

original: brjod par bya ste gang du 'dis ring por bya ba ma yin pa der yang ring po las pha rol gyi 'dra ba'i yi ge dbyi ba ji lta ba bzhin du 'gyur ro zhes pas mtshungs pa smos te /🔽ku m'a r'i ai yam /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste gang du 'dis ring por bya ba ma yin pa der yang ring po las pha rol gyi 'dra ba'i yi ge dbyi ba ji lta ba bzhin du 'gyur ro zhes pas mtshungs pa smos te / ku m'a r'i ai yam /
translated: This should be stated. Even where this is not lengthened, it is like the syllable ya, which is similar to the syllable ra, and is elided after a long vowel.🔽kumārīyam

original: ku m'a r'i yam /
analyzed: ku m'a r'i yam /
translated: kumārīyam

original: briksh'a zhes pa 'dir phyi ma dbyi ba grub bo //
analyzed: briksh'a zhes pa 'dir phyi ma dbyi ba grub bo //
translated: In this case, the latter ya is elided.

original: 'o na pha rol dbyi ba'i don du ring po nyid ring por byas par 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'o na pha rol dbyi ba'i don du ring po nyid ring por byas par 'gyur na /
translated: But if long is made long for the purpose of elision of the latter,

original: de ltar nus pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de ltar nus pa ma yin la /
translated: that is not possible.

original: ring por zhes pa'i tsvi sa gang nges par bstan /
analyzed: ring por zhes pa'i tsvi sa gang nges par bstan /
translated: The ci vowel sign is taught to be certain in the case of long.

original: des ring po ma yin pa thung ngu'i gnas nyid @79b kyis 'phangs kyis ring po ni ma yin te /
analyzed: des ring po ma yin pa thung ngu'i gnas nyid @79b kyis 'phangs kyis ring po ni ma yin te /
translated: By that, short is indicated by the state of being not long, but not long.

original: des na ci ltar ring po'i ring por 'gyur /
analyzed: des na ci ltar ring po'i ring por 'gyur /
translated: So how could long be lengthened?

original: tsvi rkyen nges par bstan pa phyi rol du byas par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: tsvi rkyen nges par bstan pa phyi rol du byas par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: The ci vowel sign taught to be certain would be made external.

original: rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i don de ltar nges par bstan pa byed de /
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i don de ltar nges par bstan pa byed de /
translated: The various meanings are taught in that way.

original: sha kam dtu la sogs pa rnams pha rol dbya ba kho na bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: sha kam dtu la sogs pa rnams pha rol dbya ba kho na bshad par bya'o //
translated: The letters śa, ka, ma, dha, and so on are to be explained as only elided in the next.

original: sgra gang rnams mchog gi sbyor ba'i rjes su 'brangs pas pha rol dbyi ba kho na mthong gi ring po ma yin pa de rnams sha kam dhu la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: sgra gang rnams mchog gi sbyor ba'i rjes su 'brangs pas pha rol dbyi ba kho na mthong gi ring po ma yin pa de rnams sha kam dhu la sogs pa ste /
translated: Those letters which are seen to be only elided by following the supreme application, not long, are those beginning with śa, ka, ma, dha.🔽śa ka am

original: sha ka aam du:/🔽sha kam dhu:/ ku la aa dh'a /
analyzed: sha ka aam du:/ sha kam dhu:/ ku la aa dh'a /
translated: śa ka ma🔽ku la a dha

original: ku la dha /🔽si'a ma aanta: s'i mam ta: skra'i yul kho na la ste /
analyzed: ku la dha / si'a ma aanta: s'i mam ta: skra'i yul kho na la ste /
translated: ku la dha🔽si ā man🔽si ma man

original: gzhan la ni si'a m'a nta'o //🔽aa'i yi ge ai'i yi ge la ae'o ;
analyzed: gzhan la ni si'a m'a nta'o // aa'i yi ge ai'i yi ge la ae'o ;
translated: In the land of Śrī, but in others si ā man.🔽The letter ā is the letter ai.

original: / ae'ang 'di yin la yi ge'ang yin pa ni aa'i yi ge ste /
analyzed: / ae'ang 'di yin la yi ge'ang yin pa ni aa'i yi ge ste /
translated: This is ā, and it is also a letter, the letter ā.

original: de bzhin du thams cad du'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du thams cad du'o //
translated: And so in all cases.

original: phyi ma dbyi'o zhes pa kho na'o //
analyzed: phyi ma dbyi'o zhes pa kho na'o //
translated: The next is elided, only.

original: aa'i yi ge ste aa yig dang a'a yig dag ai'i yi ge la ste ai yig dang a'i yig dag pha rol la ae yig dag tu 'gyur te pha rol dbyi ba'ang ngo //
analyzed: aa'i yi ge ste aa yig dang a'a yig dag ai'i yi ge la ste ai yig dang a'i yig dag pha rol la ae yig dag tu 'gyur te pha rol dbyi ba'ang ngo //
translated: The letter ā, the letters a and ā, in the letter ai, the letters i and ai, become the letter e, and also the next is elided.

original: ta be yam /
analyzed: ta be yam /
translated: ta ve yam

original: se yam / au me ha te /
analyzed: se yam / au me ha te /
translated: se yam🔽u me hate

original: mdo ru mtshams sgyor ma byas te the tshom du 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: mdo ru mtshams sgyor ma byas te the tshom du 'gyur bas so //
translated: In the sutra, the change is not made, and so there is doubt.

original: au'i yi ge la ao'o //
analyzed: au'i yi ge la ao'o //
translated: The letter Ū is for the letter O.

original: aa'i yi ge au'i yi ge la ste au yig dang a'u yig pha rol la ao nyid du 'gyur te pha rol dbyi ba yang ngo //
analyzed: aa'i yi ge au'i yi ge la ste au yig dang a'u yig pha rol la ao nyid du 'gyur te pha rol dbyi ba yang ngo //
translated: The letter AU is for the letter Ū, and for the letters Ū and Ū, the letter O is used, and the following is elided.

original: ta bod kam /🔽gam go da kam /
analyzed: ta bod kam / gam go da kam /
translated: The letter Ta is for the letter Ka.🔽The letter Ga is for the letter Go.

original: au ma ha te /
analyzed: au ma ha te /
translated: The letter Ma is for the letter Ha.

original: ri'i yi ge la aara\'o //
analyzed: ri'i yi ge la aara\'o //
translated: The letter Ri is for the letter Ar.

original: aa'i yi ge ri'i yi ge la ste ri yig dang r'i yig pha rol la aar du 'gyur zhing phyi ma dbyi ba'ang ngo //
analyzed: aa'i yi ge ri'i yi ge la ste ri yig dang r'i yig pha rol la aar du 'gyur zhing phyi ma dbyi ba'ang ngo //
translated: The letter AU is for the letter Ri, and for the letters Ri and Ra, the letter Ar is used, and the following is elided.

original: ta barnam / sardhi /
analyzed: ta barnam / sardhi /
translated: The letter Ta is for the letter Vam.🔽The letter Sa is for the letter Dhi.

original: ta ba r'i k'a ra: ta bark'a ra: ri na dang pra dang ba sa na dang / wa t'a sa ra dang / kam ba la dang / da sha rnams kyi a'i yi ge ri na'i sgra pha rol la a'ar du bsgyur par bshad par bya'o //🔽r'i n'arnam / prarnam /
analyzed: ta ba r'i k'a ra: ta bark'a ra: ri na dang pra dang ba sa na dang / wa t'a sa ra dang / kam ba la dang / da sha rnams kyi a'i yi ge ri na'i sgra pha rol la a'ar du bsgyur par bshad par bya'o // r'i n'arnam / prarnam /
translated: The letter Ta is for the letter Vam, the letter Ta is for the letter Vam, the letter Ri is for the letter Na, the letter Pra is for the letter Vasan, the letter Vata is for the letter Sar, the letter Kambala is for the letter Dasha, and the letter I is for the letter Ri, and it is explained that the letter Ar is used for the following sound.🔽The letter Ra is for the letter Nam.

original: pa sa n'arnam /
analyzed: pa sa n'arnam /
translated: The letter Pa is for the letter Nam.

original: ba ta sa r'arnam /
analyzed: ba ta sa r'arnam /
translated: The letter Va is for the letter Tasa.

original: kam ba m'arnam /
analyzed: kam ba m'arnam /
translated: The letter Ka is for the letter Kambala.

original: da sh'arnam / a'i yi ge ri ta'i sgra pha rol la gsum pa'i tshig sdud yod na a'ar du bsgyur bar bshad par bya zhing phyi ma dbyi ba'ang ngo //🔽sh'i te na ri ta: shi'a t'arta: de bzhin du /
analyzed: da sh'arnam / a'i yi ge ri ta'i sgra pha rol la gsum pa'i tshig sdud yod na a'ar du bsgyur bar bshad par bya zhing phyi ma dbyi ba'ang ngo // sh'i te na ri ta: shi'a t'arta: de bzhin du /

original: su kh'arta:/ du: kharta:/
analyzed: su kh'arta:/ du: kharta:/

original: gsum pa'i tshig sdud la zhes ba ci zhe na /

original: par lashts so ram tashts zhes pa ni /

analyzed: sa mart'a: nyer bsgyur gyi aa'i yi ge byings kyi ri yig pha rol a'ar du bsgyur bar bshad par bya zhing phyi ma dbyi ba yang do // pra ritstsha ti /

analyzed: ta boo da nam /

analyzed: proo ha: proo dha: proo dhi: ai'i yi ge 'dra ba'i yi ge ma yin pa la ya ste la rol dbyi ba ma yin pa la yang ngo //

original: pha rol dbyi bar 'gyur ba ma yin no ;
analyzed: pha rol dbyi bar 'gyur ba ma yin no ;

original: / gsal byed pha rol mtshams sbyor bay ba dgag pa 'chad par 'gyur ba'i shugs nyid las skabs 'dir dbyangs pa rol la bya bar rnams rang shes par bya'o //

translated: The connection of the next consonant is prohibited. It will be explained later. By the force of that, in this context, the vowels and consonants should be understood by oneself.

original: da dhya tra /
analyzed: da dhya tra /

analyzed: da dhi / rgyu mtshan med par ya nyid du mi 'gyur ro //

original: au'i yi ge wa'o //

translated: indav iti.🔽asau ihā.

original: aa s'a ai ha /
analyzed: aa s'a ai ha /
translated: asā ihā.

original: aa ya la sogs pa rnams kyi zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: aa ya la sogs pa rnams kyi zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of those beginning with aya?

original: goor++ya tra / ma dha tra //
analyzed: goor++ya tra / ma dha tra //
translated: gauravāt.

original: tshig mthar zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: tshig mthar zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of at the end of a word?

original: tsa ya nam /
analyzed: tsa ya nam /
translated: cayanam.

original: la wa nam /🔽tsiny sog pa la'o //🔽luny gcod pa la'o //
analyzed: la wa nam / tsiny sog pa la'o // luny gcod pa la'o //
translated: lavanam.🔽It is for cutting.🔽It is for cutting.

original: sog pa'o // gcod pa'o zhes pas yut yang ngo zhes pas yuta'o //
analyzed: sog pa'o // gcod pa'o zhes pas yut yang ngo zhes pas yuta'o //
translated: Therefore, yut.

original: yu bu dza rnams kyi zhes pas aa nas aa na ru bsgyur ba'o //
analyzed: yu bu dza rnams kyi zhes pas aa nas aa na ru bsgyur ba'o //
translated: The meaning of those beginning with yubhuja is that from a it is changed to ana.

original: aet aot las pha rol tshig mthar aa yig dbyi'o //
analyzed: aet aot las pha rol tshig mthar aa yig dbyi'o //
translated: From eta and ota, the final a is elided at the end of a word.

original: aet dang aot ste de dag ni aet aot dag go //
analyzed: aet dang aot ste de dag ni aet aot dag go //
translated: Eta and ota are eta and ota.

original: aet aot dag las pha rol ni aet aot dag las pha rol lo ;
analyzed: aet aot dag las pha rol ni aet aot dag las pha rol lo ;
translated: Beyond eta and ota is beyond eta and ota.

original: tshig mthar aet aot gang gin pa de dag las pha rol gyi aa yig dbyi bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: tshig mthar aet aot gang gin pa de dag las pha rol gyi aa yig dbyi bar 'gyur te /
translated: The a vowel of the final syllable of a word is elided after the e and o vowels.

original: aa dang aa wa dag 'gegs pa'o //
analyzed: aa dang aa wa dag 'gegs pa'o //
translated: The a and a vowels are blocked.🔽an agne, ampatra

original: aan aagne& tra /
analyzed: aan aagne& tra /
translated: vyo, ampatra

original: wayo& tra / aet aot las pha rol zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: wayo& tra / aet aot las pha rol zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is meant by “after the e and o vowels”?

original: nadya tra / madhva tra /
analyzed: nadya tra / madhva tra /
translated: nadyatra, madhvatra

original: tshig mthar zhes pa zhe na /🔽tsa ya nam /
analyzed: tshig mthar zhes pa zhe na / tsa ya nam /
translated: What is meant by “final syllable”?

original: ma wa nam /
analyzed: ma wa nam /
translated: cayanam, mavanam

original: slar yang tshig mtha' smos pa'i phyir kha cig tu mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: slar yang tshig mtha' smos pa'i phyir kha cig tu mi 'gyur te /
translated: Again, because the final syllable is mentioned, it does not apply in some cases.

original: no aa tra /
analyzed: no aa tra /
translated: no atrah

original: gsal byed la dbyangs rnams mtshams sbyor bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gsal byed la dbyangs rnams mtshams sbyor bya ba ma yin no //
translated: The vowels are not joined to the consonants.

original: gsal byed pha rol la dbyangs rnams mtshams sbyor mig bya ste mtshams sbyor bya bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsal byed pha rol la dbyangs rnams mtshams sbyor mig bya ste mtshams sbyor bya bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The vowels are not joined to the consonants after the consonants.

original: ya nyid la sogs pa rnams thun mong bas bsgrub par bya bzhin pa ni /
analyzed: ya nyid la sogs pa rnams thun mong bas bsgrub par bya bzhin pa ni /
translated: The ya and so forth are established in common.

original: gsal byed pha rol la'ang 'thob bo zhes pa 'gegs pa'o //
analyzed: gsal byed pha rol la'ang 'thob bo zhes pa 'gegs pa'o //
translated: It is blocked that they are also obtained after the consonants.

original: go gri ham /
analyzed: go gri ham /
translated: go griham

original: ma nghu bh'a dza na /
analyzed: ma nghu bh'a dza na /
translated: manghubhajan

original: ma tri manda la /
analyzed: ma tri manda la /
translated: matrimantrah

original: pi tryam zhes pa 'dir ra nyid 'dod do //
analyzed: pi tryam zhes pa 'dir ra nyid 'dod do //
translated: Here the r is desired.

original: pha 'ongs pa ni /
analyzed: pha 'ongs pa ni /
translated: The father has come.

original: pi tryam / au dang go sogs las yata\'o zhes sbyor ba 'thad pa las so//
analyzed: pi tryam / au dang go sogs las yata\'o zhes sbyor ba 'thad pa las so//
translated: The application of yataḥ from the u and go, etc. is correct.

original: go'i y'u ti pha rol la aa lba tu bsgyur bar 'dod de /
analyzed: go'i y'u ti pha rol la aa lba tu bsgyur bar 'dod de /
translated: The go's yūta is to be changed to alva in the other.

original: lam gi tshad kyi don la'o //
analyzed: lam gi tshad kyi don la'o //
translated: It is for the meaning of the measure of the path.

original: ga wyu ti //
analyzed: ga wyu ti //
translated: gavyūta🔽In another way:

original: gzhan du / go y'u ti: jo bo drag 'byor gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa slob ma la phan par mtshams sgyor gnyis pa rdzogs so //
analyzed: gzhan du / go y'u ti: jo bo drag 'byor gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa slob ma la phan par mtshams sgyor gnyis pa rdzogs so //
translated: The second chapter of the commentary composed by the venerable Gavyūta, which is beneficial for the disciples, is completed.

original: aot mtha' rnams dang aa dang ai au a' ni pa ta @81b rnams dbyangs la rang bzhin gyis so //
analyzed: aot mtha' rnams dang aa dang ai au a' ni pa ta @81b rnams dbyangs la rang bzhin gyis so //
translated: The final o, a, i, u, and ā of the nipātas are naturally vowels.

original: ni p'a ta gang rnams kyi mtha' aot yon pa de rnams aot mtha' rnams so //
analyzed: ni p'a ta gang rnams kyi mtha' aot yon pa de rnams aot mtha' rnams so //
translated: Those nipātas that end in o are the final o ones.

original: aa dang ai dang au dang a' zhes zlas dbye ba'o //
analyzed: aa dang ai dang au dang a' zhes zlas dbye ba'o //
translated: The repetition is a, i, u, and ā.

original: aot mtha' ste ao yig gi mtha' can gyi ni p'a ta gang yin pa rnams dang / de bzhin du /
analyzed: aot mtha' ste ao yig gi mtha' can gyi ni p'a ta gang yin pa rnams dang / de bzhin du /
translated: Those that end in o, that is, have the letter o at the end, and

original: aa dang ai dang au dar a' gang yin pa de rnams dbyangs rang bzhin gyis te rang gi ngo bo ji lta bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: aa dang ai dang au dar a' gang yin pa de rnams dbyangs rang bzhin gyis te rang gi ngo bo ji lta bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The vowels a, i, u, and ā, whatever they may be, are vowels by nature, in their own nature.

original: ni ai ti /
analyzed: ni ai ti /
translated: ni iti.

original: aa ho a'ashtsa ryam /
analyzed: aa ho a'ashtsa ryam /
translated: a ho aścaryam.

original: aa aa pe hi /🔽ai aindram pa shya /🔽au auttishtha / a' ae wam nu ma na+ya se /
analyzed: aa aa pe hi / ai aindram pa shya / au auttishtha / a' ae wam nu ma na+ya se /
translated: a a pe hi.🔽i indraṃ paśya.🔽u uttiṣṭha. ā evaṃ numanyase.

original: a' ae wam ki la tad /
analyzed: a' ae wam ki la tad /
translated: ā evaṃ kila tad.

original: ni p'a ta zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: ni p'a ta zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: ni pāta iti.

original: pa ta wi ham /🔽a'i dza tu lom dza tu:a'uha tu: ya dza lha mchod pa dang 'grogs par byed pa dang sbyin pa rnams la'o //🔽ba ha thob pa la'o //
analyzed: pa ta wi ham / a'i dza tu lom dza tu:a'uha tu: ya dza lha mchod pa dang 'grogs par byed pa dang sbyin pa rnams la'o // ba ha thob pa la'o //
translated: pātavi haṃ.

original: aa tu sa'o //
analyzed: aa tu sa'o //
translated: a tuṣṭiḥ.

original: so pi wa tsi zhes pas sam pra sa ra na'o //
analyzed: so pi wa tsi zhes pas sam pra sa ra na'o //
translated: so 'pi vācī samprāśanāḥ.

original: tsan pa ro& ksha zhes pas gnyis brjod pa /
analyzed: tsan pa ro& ksha zhes pas gnyis brjod pa /
translated: caṇḍaḥ akṣa iti dvayaṃ brūte.

original: rang bzhin du 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir mtshungs pa'i ring po'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin du 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir mtshungs pa'i ring po'o //
translated: samānaḥ dīrghaḥ, avyatyayāt.

original: gang gis sgrub pa yin pa de'i mtha'i'o zhes pas mtha' 'dzin pa grub pa la slar yang mtha' smos pa ni ao yig kho na'i mtha' can nyid rtogs pa'i don du ste /
analyzed: gang gis sgrub pa yin pa de'i mtha'i'o zhes pas mtha' 'dzin pa grub pa la slar yang mtha' smos pa ni ao yig kho na'i mtha' can nyid rtogs pa'i don du ste /
translated: The suffix is that by which it is accomplished. The suffix is established by the end of that. The suffix is mentioned again for the purpose of understanding that it has only the suffix o.

original: des na / aa ai au a' zhes pa 'di rnams de'i mtha' can rnams kyi rang bzhin du 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: des na / aa ai au a' zhes pa 'di rnams de'i mtha' can rnams kyi rang bzhin du 'gyur ba med do //
translated: Therefore, a, ai, au, and a are not changed into the nature of those with the suffix.

original: tse ti / ai t'i h'a /
analyzed: tse ti / ai t'i h'a /
translated: Ceti, itaiha.

original: na nvi dam /
analyzed: na nvi dam /
translated: Nanvidam.

original: we ti / dbyangs smos pa ni rnam pa gsal ba'i don du ste /
analyzed: we ti / dbyangs smos pa ni rnam pa gsal ba'i don du ste /
translated: Vetti. The mention of vowels is for the purpose of clarifying the form.

original: dbyangs kho na la mtshams sbyor gyi bya ba thob pas so //
analyzed: dbyangs kho na la mtshams sbyor gyi bya ba thob pas so //
translated: Because only the vowels obtain the function of connecting.

original: gnyis kyi tshig aoo ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis kyi tshig aoo ma yin pa'o //
translated: The word of two is not o.

original: aoo ma yin pa zhes pa dang po'i gcig gi tshig phyis pa'o //
analyzed: aoo ma yin pa zhes pa dang po'i gcig gi tshig phyis pa'o //
translated: The word of the first one is removed.

original: aoo ma yin pa'i gnyis kyi tshig gang yin pa de rang bzhin du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: aoo ma yin pa'i gnyis kyi tshig gang yin pa de rang bzhin du 'gyur ro //
translated: The word of two that is not o becomes the nature.

original: aagni aa tra /
analyzed: aagni aa tra /
translated: Agni atrā.

original: pa t'u aa n'a ya /
analyzed: pa t'u aa n'a ya /
translated: Pāṭvā nāya.

original: sh'a le aa tra /
analyzed: sh'a le aa tra /
translated: Śāle atrā.

original: aoo ma yin pa zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: aoo ma yin pa zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is not o?

original: briksh'a wa ha /
analyzed: briksh'a wa ha /
translated: Bṛkṣāvaha.

original: 'dir ci'i phyir rang bzhin du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dir ci'i phyir rang bzhin du mi 'gyur te /
translated: Why wouldn't it be natural?

original: de wa yo ri dam /
analyzed: de wa yo ri dam /
translated: It is devayori.

original: briksh'a bhy'a ma tra zhes pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: briksh'a bhy'a ma tra zhes pa'o zhe na /
translated: It is drikṣābhāyamatra.

original: aoo ma yin pa'o zhes pa 'di ni ma yin par dgag pa ste /
analyzed: aoo ma yin pa'o zhes pa 'di ni ma yin par dgag pa ste /
translated: This is an external negation, not not-o.

original: des na aoo yin dang 'dra ba'i gnyis kyi tshig yi ge tsam rang bzhin yin gyi gzhan gyi ma yin no //
analyzed: des na aoo yin dang 'dra ba'i gnyis kyi tshig yi ge tsam rang bzhin yin gyi gzhan gyi ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the mere letter of the dual case ending that is like o is natural, but not the other.

original: aos dang bhy'am ni de ltar 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes pas de dag gi rang bzhin pa nyid do //
analyzed: aos dang bhy'am ni de ltar 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes pas de dag gi rang bzhin pa nyid do //
translated: Since it is not like that with o and bhayam, they are not natural.

original: gal te med par dgag par 'gyur na de'i tshe gnyis kyi tshig aoo yig dang bral ba thams cad rang bzhin par 'gyur ro zhes pas aos @82a * //
analyzed: gal te med par dgag par 'gyur na de'i tshe gnyis kyi tshig aoo yig dang bral ba thams cad rang bzhin par 'gyur ro zhes pas aos @82a * //
translated: If it were an external negation, then all dual case endings devoid of o would be natural.

original: dang bhy'am dag kyang der 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dang bhy'am dag kyang der 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, o and bhayam would also be that.

original: gnyis kyi tshig gang aoo dang 'dra ba de ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis kyi tshig gang aoo dang 'dra ba de ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is the dual case ending that is like o?

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: It should be said.

original: aoo a'i'o // aoo yin ni snga ma'o zhes pa'i mtshan nyid kyis gang aoo yig gi rnam 'gyur yin pa'i gnyis kyi tshig de aoo yig dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: aoo a'i'o // aoo yin ni snga ma'o zhes pa'i mtshan nyid kyis gang aoo yig gi rnam 'gyur yin pa'i gnyis kyi tshig de aoo yig dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: The word au is like the letter au, by the rule: “au is the former.”

original: 'o na de phyis pa ni pha rol 'ang dbyi'o zhes pa'i tshig las de yod pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na de phyis pa ni pha rol 'ang dbyi'o zhes pa'i tshig las de yod pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But the word au is not found in the text, since it is said: “The last is changed to the next.”

original: de lta na'ang phyi ma'i rgyu mtshan can gyis bsgyur ba ni snga ma la de kho nar rtogs par bya'o zhes pas gnyis kyi tshig nyid do //
analyzed: de lta na'ang phyi ma'i rgyu mtshan can gyis bsgyur ba ni snga ma la de kho nar rtogs par bya'o zhes pas gnyis kyi tshig nyid do //
translated: Nevertheless, the change based on the next letter should be understood to apply to the former letter, and so the word au is correct.

original: de ste ma yin par dgag pa dang med par dgag pa dag la khyad par ci yod ce na /
analyzed: de ste ma yin par dgag pa dang med par dgag pa dag la khyad par ci yod ce na /
translated: If one asks: What is the difference between a non-affirming negation and an affirming negation?🔽It is said: A non-affirming negation is a negative statement in which the affirmation is not primary, and the negative is related to a following word.🔽For example: “He is not a Brahman.”

original: brjod par bya ste tshig sdud gang du sgrub pa gtso bo yin zhing dgag pa ni gtso bo ma yin pa dgag sgra tshig phyi ma dang 'brel pa de ni ma yin par dgag pa ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste tshig sdud gang du sgrub pa gtso bo yin zhing dgag pa ni gtso bo ma yin pa dgag sgra tshig phyi ma dang 'brel pa de ni ma yin par dgag pa ste /
translated: An affirming negation is a negative statement in which the negation is not primary, and the negative is related to a preceding word.

original: dper na bram ze ma yi npa 'dren par byed pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na bram ze ma yi npa 'dren par byed pa bzhin no //
translated: For example: “He is not a non-Brahman.”

original: gang du dgag pa gtso bo yin zhing sgrub pa gtso bo ma yin pa bya ba'i tshig dang lhan cig dgag tshig 'brel pa de ni med par dgag pa ste /
analyzed: gang du dgag pa gtso bo yin zhing sgrub pa gtso bo ma yin pa bya ba'i tshig dang lhan cig dgag tshig 'brel pa de ni med par dgag pa ste /
translated: Where negation is primary and affirmation is not, the negative is connected with the verbal expression.

original: dper na shid zan mi za zhes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na shid zan mi za zhes pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, “He does not eat during the day.”

original: 'dir shid zan bza' ba med do zhes pa'i don rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir shid zan bza' ba med do zhes pa'i don rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Here the meaning of “He does not eat during the day” is to be understood.

original: mang po'i tshig aa m'i'o //
analyzed: mang po'i tshig aa m'i'o //
translated: The word “many” is the feminine.

original: aa m'i zhes pa dang po'i gcig gi tshig phyis pa'o //
analyzed: aa m'i zhes pa dang po'i gcig gi tshig phyis pa'o //
translated: The word “feminine” is the first singular.

original: aa m'i zhes pa mang po'i tshig 'di rang bzhin du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: aa m'i zhes pa mang po'i tshig 'di rang bzhin du 'gyur ro //
translated: The word “feminine” is the word for “many.”

original: aa m'i'i a'a di tyam: aa das dang dza'o //
analyzed: aa m'i'i a'a di tyam: aa das dang dza'o //
translated: The feminine “ā” is “ādis” and “jā.”

original: tyad la sogs pa'i aa nyid do //
analyzed: tyad la sogs pa'i aa nyid do //
translated: The “ā” is the nature of “tya” and so forth.

original: dzasthams cad a'i'o //
analyzed: dzasthams cad a'i'o //
translated: “Ja” is all “ā.”🔽The letter “ā” is the letter “ī” in “āī.”🔽The word “ādis” is “mā” by the rule “mā of ādis.”

original: a'i yi ge ai'i yi ge la ae'o// aa da s'i tshig la ma'o zhes pas da'i ma'o //
analyzed: a'i yi ge ai'i yi ge la ae'o// aa da s'i tshig la ma'o zhes pas da'i ma'o //
translated: “Mā” is the feminine.

original: mang po nyid la ni ae ta a'i nyid do //
analyzed: mang po nyid la ni ae ta a'i nyid do //
translated: In “many,” “ā” is the nature of “e” and “ā.”

original: mang po tshig ces pa ci zhe na /🔽aa ma tra /
analyzed: mang po tshig ces pa ci zhe na / aa ma tra /
translated: What is the word “many”?🔽“Āma” is “many.”

original: aam 'di la yod do zhes pa aina\'o //
analyzed: aam 'di la yod do zhes pa aina\'o //
translated: “Āma” is “having this.”

original: si'o // ain\ han\ p'u shan aarya man rnams kyi zhes pas ring po'o //
analyzed: si'o // ain\ han\ p'u shan aarya man rnams kyi zhes pas ring po'o //
translated: The long ones are those of the words si, ein, han, pūṣan, and ārya.

original: nye bar ma bstan pa rnams kyang ngo //
analyzed: nye bar ma bstan pa rnams kyang ngo //
translated: The unmentioned ones are also.

original: nye bar ma bstan pa'i yi ge yang dag par brjod pa la dngos su ma brjod pa slu ta te de rnams rang bzhin gyis 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nye bar ma bstan pa'i yi ge yang dag par brjod pa la dngos su ma brjod pa slu ta te de rnams rang bzhin gyis 'gyur ro //
translated: The unmentioned letters are directly not expressed in the expression of the letters. They are naturally long.

original: de wa datta&amp ;
analyzed: de wa datta&amp ;
translated: Devadatta,🔽ehi,

original: ai ha / ya dznya datta auttishtha /
analyzed: ai ha / ya dznya datta auttishtha /
translated: yajñadatta uttiṣṭha.

original: 'jig rten pa'i nye bar spyod pa las ring mo nas bod pa la yang ngo zhes pa 'dis blu ta'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i nye bar spyod pa las ring mo nas bod pa la yang ngo zhes pa 'dis blu ta'o //
translated: The long ones are also from the worldly usages. This is the long one.

original: sambuddhi la aot kyi mtha' ni ai ti'i sgra pha rol la rang bzhin du yang na bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: sambuddhi la aot kyi mtha' ni ai ti'i sgra pha rol la rang bzhin du yang na bshad par bya ste /
translated: In sambuddhi, the ending of the o is the word iti. It should be explained as naturally long.

original: bh'a no ai ti /
analyzed: bh'a no ai ti /
translated: Bhāno iti,

original: bh'a na wi ti /
analyzed: bh'a na wi ti /
translated: bhāṇaviti.

original: samburdhe la zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: samburdhe la zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is sambudhe?

original: gawi tya ya ma h'a /
analyzed: gawi tya ya ma h'a /
translated: Gvittyayamaha.

original: rjes su @82b bya ba dang rjes byed pa dag gi dbye ba brjod par mi 'dod pa nyid nyid kyi phyir don dang mi ldan par gyur na rnam dbyer mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rjes su @82b bya ba dang rjes byed pa dag gi dbye ba brjod par mi 'dod pa nyid nyid kyi phyir don dang mi ldan par gyur na rnam dbyer mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The distinction of the one to be done and the one doing is not desired to be stated. If it becomes meaningless, it is not a case ending.

original: mtshungs pa'i ming can ni ri pha rol la rang bzhin du yang na ba shad par bya ste /🔽de wa rishya /
analyzed: mtshungs pa'i ming can ni ri pha rol la rang bzhin du yang na ba shad par bya ste / de wa rishya /
translated: The name of the equivalent is to be extended naturally to the other side of the mountain.🔽Devarṣi🔽Devarṣi🔽Malarṣi

original: de warshya / ma la ri shya /
analyzed: de warshya / ma la ri shya /
translated: Malarṣi

original: ma larshya / a'i dang a'a yig bud med du byas pa dag ces pas m'a l'i sgra thung ngu'o //
analyzed: ma larshya / a'i dang a'a yig bud med du byas pa dag ces pas m'a l'i sgra thung ngu'o //
translated: The short form of the word māla is by the rule: “ai and āy are made feminine.”

original: jo bo drag 'byor gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa slob ma la phan par mtshams sbyor gsum pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: jo bo drag 'byor gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa slob ma la phan par mtshams sbyor gsum pa rdzogs so /
translated: The third chapter of the commentary composed by the venerable Drahīyaśa is completed.

original: // / sde pa'i dang po'i tshig mtha' rnams dbyangs dang sgra ldan la gsum pa rnams so //
analyzed: // / sde pa'i dang po'i tshig mtha' rnams dbyangs dang sgra ldan la gsum pa rnams so //
translated: The first class has the final letters of the vowels and consonants, and the third class has the final letters of the classes.

original: sde pa rnams kyi dang po ka tsa ta ta pa tshig mtha' rnams te tshig gi mthar pa rnams dbyangs dang sgra ldan rnams pha rol la rang gi snge pa'i nye ba las gsum pa rnams su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sde pa rnams kyi dang po ka tsa ta ta pa tshig mtha' rnams te tshig gi mthar pa rnams dbyangs dang sgra ldan rnams pha rol la rang gi snge pa'i nye ba las gsum pa rnams su 'gyur ro //
translated: The first letters of the classes are ka, ca, ṭa, ta, pa, and the final letters of the words are the final letters of the classes. The final letters of the words that have the vowels and consonants become the third class from their own preceding proximate.

original: re zhig dbyangs la /
analyzed: re zhig dbyangs la /
translated: First, the vowels:

original: w'a ga tra /
analyzed: w'a ga tra /
translated: Vāgīśa

original: sha d'a na ya /
analyzed: sha d'a na ya /
translated: Śādanaya

original: ta di ha /
analyzed: ta di ha /
translated: Tādhi

original: trishtru bi yam /
analyzed: trishtru bi yam /
translated: Tṛṣṭruviya

original: sgra dang ldan pa rnams la /
analyzed: sgra dang ldan pa rnams la /
translated: The consonants:

original: w'agga ti / shadgatstsham ti /
analyzed: w'agga ti / shadgatstsham ti /
translated: Vāgati, Śadgacchati,

original: tadga ma nam /
analyzed: tadga ma nam /
translated: Tadgamanaṃ,🔽Tristhuvāyati.

original: trishtubg'a ya t'i: sde pa'i dang po rnams zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: trishtubg'a ya t'i: sde pa'i dang po rnams zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: The first members of the classes, what is it?

original: bha ga w'a n'a ha /
analyzed: bha ga w'a n'a ha /
translated: Bhagavānāha.

original: tshig mtha' zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: tshig mtha' zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: The end of the word, what is it?🔽Vidyuto.

original: bidyu too / dbyangs dang sgra ldan rnams la zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: bidyu too / dbyangs dang sgra ldan rnams la zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: The ones with vowels and sounds, what is it?

original: w'a kpu n'a ti /
analyzed: w'a kpu n'a ti /
translated: Vākpūnati.

original: lnga pa la snga pa rnams su ste yang na ma yin par gsum pa rnams so //
analyzed: lnga pa la snga pa rnams su ste yang na ma yin par gsum pa rnams so //
translated: In the fifth, the former ones, or else the third ones.

original: tha tshig smos pa ni /
analyzed: tha tshig smos pa ni /
translated: The meaning is stated.

original: na mtha' tsa tsha dag la zhes pa 'di las gong du rjes su 'jug go //
analyzed: na mtha' tsa tsha dag la zhes pa 'di las gong du rjes su 'jug go //
translated: The end of the word, the first members of the classes, this is applied above.

original: sde pa'i dang po tshig mtha' can rnams rang gi sde pa'i lnga pa'am /
analyzed: sde pa'i dang po tshig mtha' can rnams rang gi sde pa'i lnga pa'am /
translated: The ones with the end of the word become the fifth of their own class,

original: yang na gsum par 'gyur te lnga pa pha rol la'o //
analyzed: yang na gsum par 'gyur te lnga pa pha rol la'o //
translated: or else the third, the fifth is for the other.

original: wa'dma dhu ra:/ w'agma dhu ra:/
analyzed: wa'dma dhu ra:/ w'agma dhu ra:/
translated: Vādamdhuraḥ, Vāgmadhuraḥ,

original: shanna ya nam /
analyzed: shanna ya nam /
translated: Śaṇṇayanam,

original: shadna ya na:/ tanni ti: tadn'i ti: tadn'i ti: trishtrummi no ta /
analyzed: shadna ya na:/ tanni ti: tadn'i ti: tadn'i ti: trishtrummi no ta /
translated: Śaṇṇayanam, Tanniti, Tadānīti, Tadānīti, Tristhuvaminota,

original: trishtrubmi no ti //
analyzed: trishtrubmi no ti //
translated: Tristhuvaminoti.

original: lnga pa la de yang na'o zhes brjod par bya ba la mdo tshegs che bar byas pa las snge ba'i dang po ni lnga pa dang po can gyi rkyen pha rol la rtag tu lnga par 'gyur te /🔽ngag gi rnam 'gyur ni w'angma yam /
analyzed: lnga pa la de yang na'o zhes brjod par bya ba la mdo tshegs che bar byas pa las snge ba'i dang po ni lnga pa dang po can gyi rkyen pha rol la rtag tu lnga par 'gyur te / ngag gi rnam 'gyur ni w'angma yam /
translated: In the fifth, it is said to be “that too,” and the first of the first in the fifth is always the fifth in the case of the other.

original: tvam ma yam /
analyzed: tvam ma yam /
translated: The transformation of the vowel is waṃ or yaṃ.🔽The transformation of the vowel is taṃ or yaṃ.

original: a'a khya ta las kyang ta ma sogs rnams sa zhes pas ma ya ta'o //
analyzed: a'a khya ta las kyang ta ma sogs rnams sa zhes pas ma ya ta'o //
translated: From ā, khya, and ta, etc., the sa is ma, and the ya is ta.

original: de 'di'i tshad yin pa ni /
analyzed: de 'di'i tshad yin pa ni /
translated: This is the measure of that.

original: tanm'a tram\/ de bzhin du /
analyzed: tanm'a tram\/ de bzhin du /
translated: Similarly,

original: yanm'a tra ma /
analyzed: yanm'a tra ma /
translated: ya is ma.

original: aet banma tram\/ snga ma bzhin du m'a trata'i rkyen no //
analyzed: aet banma tram\/ snga ma bzhin du m'a trata'i rkyen no //
translated: As before, the condition of ma is ta.

original: sde pa'i dang po rnams las sha yig dbyangs dang ya wa ra pha rol can ni tsha yig ste yang na ma yin no //
analyzed: sde pa'i dang po rnams las sha yig dbyangs dang ya wa ra pha rol can ni tsha yig ste yang na ma yin no //
translated: From the first of the classes, the letter ṣa with a vowel and ya, wa, and ra is the letter ṣa, or it is not.

original: dbyangs dang ya dang wa dang ra dang de rnams ni dbyangs dang ya wa ra rnams so //
analyzed: dbyangs dang ya dang wa dang ra dang de rnams ni dbyangs dang ya wa ra rnams so //
translated: The vowel, ya, wa, and ra are the vowel, ya, wa, and ra.

original: @83a * // dbyangs dang ya wa ra rnams pha rol yin ba zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: @83a * // dbyangs dang ya wa ra rnams pha rol yin ba zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The vowel, ya, wa, and ra are the other. The words are combined.

original: sde pa'i dang po tshig mtha' can rnams las pha rol gyi sha yig dbyangs ya wa ra pha rol can te dbyang pha rol can dang / ya pha rol can dang / wa pha rol can dang / ra pha rol can ni tsha yig tu 'gyur te yang na ma yin no //
analyzed: sde pa'i dang po tshig mtha' can rnams las pha rol gyi sha yig dbyangs ya wa ra pha rol can te dbyang pha rol can dang / ya pha rol can dang / wa pha rol can dang / ra pha rol can ni tsha yig tu 'gyur te yang na ma yin no //
translated: The first of the classes, from those ending in a syllable, the other side of the letter sha, the vowel ya, wa, ra, the other side, that is, the other side of the vowel ya, the other side of the letter wa, the other side of the letter ra, becomes the letter tsa, or not.

original: w'aktshu ra: w'aksh'u ra: sha ttshy'a ma: shatshhy'a ma: tatstshve tam /
analyzed: w'aktshu ra: w'aksh'u ra: sha ttshy'a ma: shatshhy'a ma: tatstshve tam /
translated: vākshurāḥ, vākshurāḥ, śatśayām, śaṣhayām, tacchvetat.

original: tatsshre tam / phyog gcig la sha la tsa'o zhes pas ta yig tsa'o //🔽trishtruptshru ya te /
analyzed: tatsshre tam / phyog gcig la sha la tsa'o zhes pas ta yig tsa'o // trishtruptshru ya te /
translated: tacchvetat. In one direction, since it is said that sha becomes tsa, the letter ta becomes tsa.🔽triṣṭhupcchrūyate.

original: trishtrupshru ya te /
analyzed: trishtrupshru ya te /
translated: triṣṭhupcchrūyate.

original: sde pa'i dang po rnams la zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: sde pa'i dang po rnams la zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is meant by the first of the classes?

original: pra tya she te /
analyzed: pra tya she te /
translated: pratyāśet.

original: sde pa'i dang po smos pa ni rnam pa gsal ba'i don to //
analyzed: sde pa'i dang po smos pa ni rnam pa gsal ba'i don to //
translated: The mention of the first of the classes is for the purpose of clarifying the form.

original: dbyangs dang ya ba rab ro la can zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: dbyangs dang ya ba rab ro la can zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is meant by the other side of the vowel ya, wa, ra?

original: w'akshla / kshnam\ la dang rjes su sna ldan pha rol can gyi sha yig kyang tsha nyid du yang na 'dod de /
analyzed: w'akshla / kshnam\ la dang rjes su sna ldan pha rol can gyi sha yig kyang tsha nyid du yang na 'dod de /
translated: vākshlaḥ, kṣaṇam. The letter sha, which has the other side of the vowel ya, wa, ra, is also desired to be tsa, or not.

original: slar yang yang na min pa smos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: slar yang yang na min pa smos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Again, it is not so.

original: tatstshl'aghyam / tatstshshl'aghyam /🔽tatstshma sh'a nam /
analyzed: tatstshl'aghyam / tatstshshl'aghyam / tatstshma sh'a nam /
translated: TCTSHALAGH-YAM, TCTSHSHALAGH-YAM,🔽TCTSHMANSHANAM,

original: tatsshma sh'a nam /
analyzed: tatsshma sh'a nam /
translated: TCTSHMANSHANAM.

original: de rnams kho na la ha yig snga ma'i bzhi pa ste yang na ma yin no //
analyzed: de rnams kho na la ha yig snga ma'i bzhi pa ste yang na ma yin no //
translated: In those very [syllables], the fourth of the previous HA syllable, or not.

original: de rnams te sde pa'i dang po tshig mtha' rnams las pha rol gyi ha yig snga ma'i yi ge bzhi par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de rnams te sde pa'i dang po tshig mtha' rnams las pha rol gyi ha yig snga ma'i yi ge bzhi par 'gyur te /
translated: Those, the first of the group, from the final syllables, the fourth of the previous HA syllable on the other side,

original: yang na ma ma yin no //
analyzed: yang na ma ma yin no //
translated: or not.

original: w'aggh'i na: wagh'i na: wagh'i na: shaddha l'a ni /
analyzed: w'aggh'i na: wagh'i na: wagh'i na: shaddha l'a ni /
translated: VAGHA-NI, VAGHA-NI, VAGHA-NI, SHADHALANI,

original: shadha l'a ni /🔽taddhi tam / tadhi tam /
analyzed: shadha l'a ni / taddhi tam / tadhi tam /
translated: SHADHALANI,🔽TADDHITAM, TADDHITAM,

original: trisht'ubbhatam / trishtru bha tam /
analyzed: trisht'ubbhatam / trishtru bha tam /
translated: TRISHTOVBHADAM, TRISHTOVBHADAM.

original: de rnams kho na las zhes pa ci zhes na /
analyzed: de rnams kho na las zhes pa ci zhes na /
translated: In those very [syllables], what is said?

original: pra tyunghas ti //
analyzed: pra tyunghas ti //
translated: PRATYUHNASHTI.

original: ta yig la dang tsa ta'i sde pa rnams la pha rol gyi gzhugs so //
analyzed: ta yig la dang tsa ta'i sde pa rnams la pha rol gyi gzhugs so //
translated: The TA syllable and the group of the CATA group on the other side.

original: tsa dang ta ni tsa ta dag ste tsa ta dag gi sde pa ni tsa ta'i snge pa'o //
analyzed: tsa dang ta ni tsa ta dag ste tsa ta dag gi sde pa ni tsa ta'i snge pa'o //
translated: CA and TA are CATA, and the group of the CATA group is the CATA group.

original: la dang tsa ta'i sde pa de rnams ni la dang tsa ta'i sde pa rnams so //
analyzed: la dang tsa ta'i sde pa de rnams ni la dang tsa ta'i sde pa rnams so //
translated: The La and Ca-Ta groups are the La and Ca-Ta groups.

original: ta yig tshig mtha' can rnams la yig dang tsa sde dang ta sde pha rol la pha rol gyi gzugs te pha rol gyi yi ge'i gzugs gang gang yin pa der 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ta yig tshig mtha' can rnams la yig dang tsa sde dang ta sde pha rol la pha rol gyi gzugs te pha rol gyi yi ge'i gzugs gang gang yin pa der 'gyur ro //
translated: For those ending in the letter Ta, the letter Ya and the Ca group and the Ta group are the form of the other, that is, the form of the other letter.

original: tallu n'a ti /🔽tatstsi n'a ti /
analyzed: tallu n'a ti / tatstsi n'a ti /
translated: Ta-llū-nā-ti.🔽Ta-ccī-nā-ti.

original: tatstsi no ti /
analyzed: tatstsi no ti /
translated: Ta-ccī-no-ti.

original: tatstsh'a da ya ti /🔽tadzdza ya ti //
analyzed: tatstsh'a da ya ti / tadzdza ya ti //
translated: Ta-ccha-dāya-ti.🔽Ta-jja-yā-ti.

original: tadzdzha ya ti /
analyzed: tadzdzha ya ti /
translated: Ta-jja-hya-ti.

original: nghut rnams kyi gsum pa'o zhes pas dzha'i dza'o //🔽tanynya k'a ra: tatt'i ka te /
analyzed: nghut rnams kyi gsum pa'o zhes pas dzha'i dza'o // tanynya k'a ra: tatt'i ka te /
translated: The third of the Nhu-s is the Ja of Jhi.🔽Ta-nya-kāraḥ, ta-tthī-kate.

original: tattha kku ra: taddi na: taddhoo ka te ;
analyzed: tattha kku ra: taddi na: taddhoo ka te ;
translated: Ta-ttha-kū-raḥ, ta-dī-naḥ, ta-ddhū-kate.

original: snga ma bzhin du gsum pa ste dha'i da'o //🔽tanna k'a ra: ta yig ces pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du gsum pa ste dha'i da'o // tanna k'a ra: ta yig ces pa ci zhe na /
translated: The third as before is the Da of Dhi.🔽Ta-nna-kāraḥ, ta-yī-ka.

original: waktsa ra ti /
analyzed: waktsa ra ti /
translated: What is said? Vak-cāra-ti.

original: la dang tsa ta'i sde pa rnams la zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: la dang tsa ta'i sde pa rnams la zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is said about the La and Ca-Ta groups?

original: tatpa tsa ti //
analyzed: tatpa tsa ti //
translated: Ta-tpa-cāti.

original: sha la tsa'o //
analyzed: sha la tsa'o //
translated: The Sha is the Ca.

original: ta yig tshig mtha' can sha la te sha yig pha rol la tsa ru 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ta yig tshig mtha' can sha la te sha yig pha rol la tsa ru 'gyur ro //
translated: For those ending in the letter Ta, the Sha is the Ta, and the other of the Sha letter becomes Ca.

original: tatsshla ghya ma /
analyzed: tatsshla ghya ma /
translated: ṭa, śa, ṣa, sa, ha.

original: tatsshlan nam / phyogs @83b gang la sha yig gi tsha nyid med pa de la 'dis tsa nyid du bsgrub par bya zhing /
analyzed: tatsshlan nam / phyogs @83b gang la sha yig gi tsha nyid med pa de la 'dis tsa nyid du bsgrub par bya zhing /
translated: In which direction there is no ṣa, this establishes ṣa there.

original: tsha nyid kyi phyogs la ni mdo don med par 'gyur te pha rol gyi gzugs su byas pa na sbyor ba rnams grub ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: tsha nyid kyi phyogs la ni mdo don med par 'gyur te pha rol gyi gzugs su byas pa na sbyor ba rnams grub ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: In the direction of ṣa, the meaning of the sūtra would be meaningless, because when it is made into the form of the opponent, the applications are established as just that.

original: da na na au pa dh'a thung ngu can rnams dbyangs la gnyis so //
analyzed: da na na au pa dh'a thung ngu can rnams dbyangs la gnyis so //
translated: Now, in na, the short upadhās are two in the vowel.

original: nga na na gang rnams kyi au pa dh'a rnams thung ngu yin pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: nga na na gang rnams kyi au pa dh'a rnams thung ngu yin pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: In na, those whose upadhās are short, the words are connected.

original: dbyangs thung ngu zhes sbyor ba 'thad pa las au pa dh'a'i sgra thung ngu'o //
analyzed: dbyangs thung ngu zhes sbyor ba 'thad pa las au pa dh'a'i sgra thung ngu'o //
translated: From the correct connection of short vowel, the sound upadha is short.

original: lan gnyis dag gnyis te /
analyzed: lan gnyis dag gnyis te /
translated: The two are twice.

original: aa khya ta las kyang ta ma sogs rnams so zhes pas su rkyen te 'di ni mi zad pa'o //
analyzed: aa khya ta las kyang ta ma sogs rnams so zhes pas su rkyen te 'di ni mi zad pa'o //
translated: Also from a khyata, the tā etc. are the conditions. This is inexhaustible.

original: nga na na tshig mtha' au pa dh'a thung ngu can rnams dbyangs pha rol la gnyis su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nga na na tshig mtha' au pa dh'a thung ngu can rnams dbyangs pha rol la gnyis su 'gyur ro //
translated: In na, the words ending in short upadhās become two in the vowel of the opponent.

analyzed: krudda tra / su gann'a ha /
translated: kruddhatra🔽sugnānaha

analyzed: pa tsanni ha /
translated: pacannihā

analyzed: nga na na rnams zhes pa ci zhe na /

analyzed: tva mi ha /
translated: tavamīhā

original: tshig mtha' zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: tshig mtha' zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: vacanānte

original: au sha noo /
analyzed: au sha noo /
translated: uṣaṇo🔽aupaghāḥ

analyzed: a'u pa dh'a thung ngu can rnams zhes pa ci zhe na /

analyzed: bha w'a n'a hnya / dbyangs la zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: svarānte

analyzed: su ga na ga ta / na mtha' tsa tsha dag la sha yig ste snga mar rjes su nga mar rjes su ng ro'o // sha yig geng las snga ma rjes su nga ro yin zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //

analyzed: tsa tsha dag la zhes pa ci zhe na /

analyzed: bha w'a narko ti //

analyzed: pr'a sh'an gyi sgra'i ni 'dod pa ma yin te / pra sh'a ntsi no ti /
translated: na tu prasānasya śabdasya🔽prasāṇacinoti

analyzed: pra sh'antsh'a da ya ti /
translated: prasāṃścaṣādayati

original: de bzhin du mdo phyi ma dag la yang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du mdo phyi ma dag la yang ngo //
translated: Likewise in the following verses.

original: ta tha dag la sha yig go //
analyzed: ta tha dag la sha yig go //
translated: The letter Ṣa is substituted for all Ta and Tha.

original: na yig tshig mtha' can ta tha dag pha rol la rjes su nga ro sngon ma can gyi sha yig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: na yig tshig mtha' can ta tha dag pha rol la rjes su nga ro sngon ma can gyi sha yig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: The letter Ṣa is substituted for all Ta and Tha, when followed by a word ending in a nasal.

analyzed: bha w'amshta ka te ;
translated: Bhavam śaṭha ka te

analyzed: pra sh'an\ t'i ka te / pra sh'an\ thakku ra: ta tha dag la sa yig go //
