analyzed: bha w'a sthu da ti /

analyzed: 'dir mi 'gyur te / pra sh'an\ ta no ti /

analyzed: pra sh'an thu da ti /
translated: Praśānta sthūda ti.

original: la la la'o na yig tshig mtha' can la la ste la yig pha rol la rjes su nga ro sngon ma can gyi la yig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: la la la'o na yig tshig mtha' can la la ste la yig pha rol la rjes su nga ro sngon ma can gyi la yig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: The letter Ṣa is substituted for all Ta and Tha, when followed by a word ending in a nasal.

original: bha w'am llu n'a ti //
analyzed: bha w'am llu n'a ti //
translated: Bhavam llunāti

original: dza dzha nya sha yig rnams la nya yig go //
analyzed: dza dzha nya sha yig rnams la nya yig go //
translated: Ja, Jha, Ṇa, and Ṣa become Ṇa.

original: na yig tshig mtha' can dza yig dang dzha yig dang nya yig dan sha yig pha rol la nya yig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: na yig tshig mtha' can dza yig dang dzha yig dang nya yig dan sha yig pha rol la nya yig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: The letter na at the end of a word becomes the letter ja, the letter jha, the letter nya, the letter śa, and the letter sa, in the other [syllable].

original: @84a * // ma h'anydza ya ti /
analyzed: @84a * // ma h'anydza ya ti /
translated: mahāñjayati

original: ma h'anydza kha ti /
analyzed: ma h'anydza kha ti /
translated: mahāñjakhati

original: ma h'a nynya k'a ra: ma h'a nyshe te /
analyzed: ma h'a nynya k'a ra: ma h'a nyshe te /
translated: mahāññakāraḥ mahāñśete

original: sha la nya dag kyang ngo //
analyzed: sha la nya dag kyang ngo //
translated: śa and la also.

original: na yig tshig mtha' can sha la se sha yig pha rol la nya ra 'gyur te /
analyzed: na yig tshig mtha' can sha la se sha yig pha rol la nya ra 'gyur te /
translated: The letter na at the end of a word becomes the letter nya in the other [syllable].

original: kyang gi sgra ni bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: kyang gi sgra ni bsdu ba'o //
translated: The word also includes [the following].

original: ma h'a nytstsh'u ra: nytsa dag ces sogs la bsgyur ba ste /
analyzed: ma h'a nytstsh'u ra: nytsa dag ces sogs la bsgyur ba ste /
translated: mahāñcūruḥ, añca

original: gal te bsgyur ba gnyis dag tu 'gyur na de'i tshe nya yig tu bsgyur ba'i sgrub pa don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te bsgyur ba gnyis dag tu 'gyur na de'i tshe nya yig tu bsgyur ba'i sgrub pa don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If there were two changes, then the application of the change to nya would be pointless.

original: gnyis kyi tshig bstan pa ni rnam pa ni rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i don to //
analyzed: gnyis kyi tshig bstan pa ni rnam pa ni rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i don to //
translated: The teaching of the two words is that the form is of various meanings.

original: da dha na pha rol can ni na yig go //
analyzed: da dha na pha rol can ni na yig go //
translated: The other [syllable] that has na is the letter na.

original: da dang dha dang na ste de rnams ni da dha na rnams so //
analyzed: da dang dha dang na ste de rnams ni da dha na rnams so //
translated: Da, dha, and na - those are the das.

original: de rnams na yig gang las pha rol yin ba zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: de rnams na yig gang las pha rol yin ba zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The suffix na is added to those, and then the word is formed by adding the word for the other side.

original: na yig tshig mtha' can da pha rol dang dha pha rol can dang na pha rol can ni na yig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: na yig tshig mtha' can da pha rol dang dha pha rol can dang na pha rol can ni na yig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: The suffix na is added to the words for the other side of da, the other side of dha, and the other side of na.

original: ma h'and'i na /🔽ma h'andhoo kate /
analyzed: ma h'and'i na / ma h'andhoo kate /
translated: mahāndhe🔽mahāndhokte🔽mahānnākaras tad dhanānām.

original: ma h'anna k'a ra: da dha na rnams la zhes par ma byas pa ni rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i don to //
analyzed: ma h'anna k'a ra: da dha na rnams la zhes par ma byas pa ni rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i don to //
translated: The suffix na is not added to the words for the other side of ma, ha, ḍha, and na, because it has various meanings.

original: ma gsal byed la rjes su nga ro'o //
analyzed: ma gsal byed la rjes su nga ro'o //
translated: The suffix ṇa is added to the consonants.

original: ma yig tshig mtha' can gsal byed pha rol la rjes su nga ror 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma yig tshig mtha' can gsal byed pha rol la rjes su nga ror 'gyur ro //
translated: The suffix ṇa is added to the consonants that end in a word.

original: tvam ha sa si //
analyzed: tvam ha sa si //
translated: taṃ hasasi

original: tvam ra ma se /
analyzed: tvam ra ma se /
translated: taṃ ramasi

original: ma zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: ma zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is ma?

original: bha b'an ma te /
analyzed: bha b'an ma te /
translated: bhavān mataḥ

original: tshig mtha' zhes pa ci zhe na ga mya te /
analyzed: tshig mtha' zhes pa ci zhe na ga mya te /
translated: What is the end of a word?🔽gamaya te

original: gsal byed la zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: gsal byed la zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is a consonant?

original: tva ma tra /
analyzed: tva ma tra /
translated: taṃ matraḥ🔽The suffix ṇa is added to the clear consonants.

original: sam\ gyi ma yig gi r'a dzi gsal ba la'o zhes pa kvi pa'i mtha' can pha rol la rjes su nga ro mi 'dod de /
analyzed: sam\ gyi ma yig gi r'a dzi gsal ba la'o zhes pa kvi pa'i mtha' can pha rol la rjes su nga ro mi 'dod de /
translated: The suffix ṇa is not added to the other side of the word ending in kṣa.

original: samr'at / r'a dzri dang sam\ snga ma'o //
analyzed: samr'at / r'a dzri dang sam\ snga ma'o //
translated: the former.

original: yang dag par gsal bar byed do zhes pas kvi ba'o //
analyzed: yang dag par gsal bar byed do zhes pas kvi ba'o //
translated: It is said samrata (it illuminates perfectly).

original: si'o // ha shash tsha zhes pas dza'i da'o /
analyzed: si'o // ha shash tsha zhes pas dza'i da'o /
translated: It is said ha śaśa tsa (it is the moon).

original: rdzogs pa la yang na'o zhes pas da'i ta'o //
analyzed: rdzogs pa la yang na'o zhes pas da'i ta'o //
translated: It is said nauta (it is the ocean).

original: kvipa\'o mtha' can zhes pa ci zhes na /
analyzed: kvipa\'o mtha' can zhes pa ci zhes na /
translated: It is said kavi (it is a poet).

original: sam ra dzi ta /
analyzed: sam ra dzi ta /
translated: It is said samrajita (it is a king).

original: sde pa la de'i sde pa'i lnga pa 'ang na'o //
analyzed: sde pa la de'i sde pa'i lnga pa 'ang na'o //
translated: In the case of a group, the fifth of that group is also nauta (it is the ocean).

original: sde pa la yod pa ni sde pa ste /
analyzed: sde pa la yod pa ni sde pa ste /
translated: That which exists in a group is a group.

original: au dang / go sogs las yata'o zhes sbyor ba 'thad pa las yata\'o / de'i sde pa ni de nyid nyid kyi sde pa'o //
analyzed: au dang / go sogs las yata'o zhes sbyor ba 'thad pa las yata\'o / de'i sde pa ni de nyid nyid kyi sde pa'o //
translated: It is said yata (it is a cause) from the root yuj (to yoke) in the sense of being suitable. That group is the very same group.

original: sde pa de'i lnga pa ni sde de'i lnga pa'o //
analyzed: sde pa de'i lnga pa ni sde de'i lnga pa'o //
translated: The fifth of that group is the fifth of that group.

original: ma yig tshig mtha' can sde pa pha rol la sde dang 'brel pa'i sde pa de'i lnga par yang na 'gyur te /
analyzed: ma yig tshig mtha' can sde pa pha rol la sde dang 'brel pa'i sde pa de'i lnga par yang na 'gyur te /
translated: The letter ma at the end of a word is the fifth of that group connected with the group on the other side.

original: snga mas rjes su nga ro rtag tu thob pa la'o //🔽tvadka ro shi /🔽tvi ka ro shi //🔽tvanytsa ra si //
analyzed: snga mas rjes su nga ro rtag tu thob pa la'o // tvadka ro shi / tvi ka ro shi // tvanytsa ra si //
translated: It is said kavi (it is a poet) in the sense of always obtaining a subsequent vowel.🔽 It is said tvaḍakaroṣi (you are a poet).

original: tvam ra si //
analyzed: tvam ra si //
translated: It is said tvaḍikaroṣi (you are a poet).🔽 It is said tvaṇcaratsi (you are a poet).🔽 It is said tvamarasī (you are a poet).🔽 It is said tvaḍakaroṣi (you are a poet).

original: ma yig mthar gnas pha rol la rjes su nga ro snga ma can dang bcas pa'i pha rol gyi 'dra ba'i yi ger yang na bshad par bya'o //🔽sam wav'at+sa ra /
analyzed: ma yig mthar gnas pha rol la rjes su nga ro snga ma can dang bcas pa'i pha rol gyi 'dra ba'i yi ger yang na bshad par bya'o // sam wav'at+sa ra /
translated: The letter at the end of the vowel is changed to the corresponding letter of the next row, with the preceding vowel.🔽samvātsara

original: samwv'at+sa ra:/ tam llokam /
analyzed: samwv'at+sa ra:/ tam llokam /
translated: samvātsaraḥ

original: tamlo kam\/ jo bo drag 'byor gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel ba slob ma la phan par mtshams @84b sbyor bzhi pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: tamlo kam\/ jo bo drag 'byor gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel ba slob ma la phan par mtshams @84b sbyor bzhi pa rdzogs so /
translated: The fourth chapter of the commentary composed by the venerable Drahīyaśas, which is helpful for students, is complete.

original: // / rnam par gcad bya tsa 'am tshal sha'o //
analyzed: // / rnam par gcad bya tsa 'am tshal sha'o //
translated: The letter to be deleted is ca or ṣa.

original: rnam par gcad par bya ba tsa yig dang tsha yig pha rol la sha yig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par gcad par bya ba tsa yig dang tsha yig pha rol la sha yig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: The letter to be deleted, the letter ca or ṣa, becomes the letter śa in the next row.

original: 'am gyi sgra ni sdud pa la ste mdo phyi ma dag la'ang do //
analyzed: 'am gyi sgra ni sdud pa la ste mdo phyi ma dag la'ang do //
translated: The word or includes the following sutras.🔽kṣacca yate

original: kashtsa yate / kashtsha da ya te /
analyzed: kashtsa yate / kashtsha da ya te /
translated: kṣacca dadāte

original: hari'i sgra'i tsandra'i sgra pha rol la sha yig a' ga ma bshad par bya ba ste /
analyzed: hari'i sgra'i tsandra'i sgra pha rol la sha yig a' ga ma bshad par bya ba ste /
translated: The word or changes the word candra to the word śa in the next row.

original: gal te drang srong brjod par bya bar gyur na'o //
analyzed: gal te drang srong brjod par bya bar gyur na'o //
translated: If the sage is to be expressed.

original: ha ri shtsandra: gzhan du ha ri tsandra'o //
analyzed: ha ri shtsandra: gzhan du ha ri tsandra'o //
translated: Hariścandra, otherwise Hariścandra.

original: ta'am tha la sha'o //
analyzed: ta'am tha la sha'o //
translated: taṃ tha la śa

original: rnam par gcad bya ta dang tha dag pha rol la sha yig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par gcad bya ta dang tha dag pha rol la sha yig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: The letter ta and tha are replaced by the letter śa in the following.

original: kashti ka te /
analyzed: kashti ka te /
translated: kṣattikate

original: dashtha kku ra /
analyzed: dashtha kku ra /
translated: daśathakakura

original: go'i ba ta'i sgra pha rol la sha a'a ga ma bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: go'i ba ta'i sgra pha rol la sha a'a ga ma bshad par bya ste /
translated: The word goḥ is explained as śa in the following.

original: gal te bsten pa dang tshad yin par 'gyur na'o //
analyzed: gal te bsten pa dang tshad yin par 'gyur na'o //
translated: If it is a case of the genitive and the locative.

original: goshpa do da sha: go rnams kyi bsten pa'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: goshpa do da sha: go rnams kyi bsten pa'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: goḥpaḍo daśaḥ. The meaning is: of the cows.

original: tshad la ni /
analyzed: tshad la ni /
translated: In the locative case,

original: goshpa do dza l'a sha ya /
analyzed: goshpa do dza l'a sha ya /
translated: goḥpaḍo jalāśaye🔽gośapadaṃ pūrṇam. Elsewhere,

original: go sha pa da p'u ram de go brishta: gzhan du ni /🔽go pa dam'o //
analyzed: go sha pa da p'u ram de go brishta: gzhan du ni / go pa dam'o //
translated: goḥpadaṃ.

original: ta'am thal sa'o //
analyzed: ta'am thal sa'o //
translated: tāṃ talasām.

original: rnam par gcas bya ta tha dag pha rol la sa ru 'gyur ro //🔽kasta ra ti ;
analyzed: rnam par gcas bya ta tha dag pha rol la sa ru 'gyur ro // kasta ra ti ;
translated: The letter ta and tha are replaced by the letter sa in the following.🔽kastarati

original: kasthu da ti //
analyzed: kasthu da ti //
translated: kasthurati

original: a'adra las pa da'i sgra pha rol la sa yig a' ga ma bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: a'adra las pa da'i sgra pha rol la sa yig a' ga ma bshad par bya ste /
translated: The word āpada is explained as sa in the following.

original: a'aspa dam\/ gzhan zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: a'aspa dam\/ gzhan zhes pa'i don to //
translated: āpadaṃ means: another.

original: gzhan las ni /
analyzed: gzhan las ni /
translated: From another,

original: a'a pa dam\'o //
analyzed: a'a pa dam\'o //
translated: āpadaṃ no.

original: tadra dang bri had ces pa 'di dag gi rim pa ji lta bar ga ra dang pa ti dag pha rol la sa yig tu bsgur bar bshad par bya ste ;
analyzed: tadra dang bri had ces pa 'di dag gi rim pa ji lta bar ga ra dang pa ti dag pha rol la sa yig tu bsgur bar bshad par bya ste ;
translated: The sequence of these, tadra and bhrīṣa, is to be bent to the other side, namely, gara and pati.

original: rim pa ji lta bar chom rkun dang lha nyid dag gi don la'o //
analyzed: rim pa ji lta bar chom rkun dang lha nyid dag gi don la'o //
translated: The sequence is for the meaning of “thief” and “god,” respectively.

original: taska ra: bri haspa ti: gzhan la ni /
analyzed: taska ra: bri haspa ti: gzhan la ni /
translated: In the other, tadra and bhrīṣa.

original: tatka ra: bri hatva ti: ka kha dag la lce rtsa can te yang na ma yin no //
analyzed: tatka ra: bri hatva ti: ka kha dag la lce rtsa can te yang na ma yin no //
translated: In ka and kha, the tongue root, or not.

original: rnam par gcad bya pha rol la ka kha dag lce rtsa can du 'gyur te yang na ma yin no //🔽ka thka  ro ti:/
analyzed: rnam par gcad bya pha rol la ka kha dag lce rtsa can du 'gyur te yang na ma yin no // ka thka  ro ti:/
translated: In the other, ka and kha, the tongue root, or not.🔽Ka and tha are roți.

original: ka:ka ro ti /🔽kathkha  na ti /
analyzed: ka:ka ro ti / kathkha  na ti /
translated: Ka and ka are roți.🔽Ka and tha are nāți.

original: ka: khan ti //
analyzed: ka: khan ti //
translated: Ka and kha are nāți.

original: shit pha rol can gyi ka kha dag la mi 'dod de /
analyzed: shit pha rol can gyi ka kha dag la mi 'dod de /
translated: The ka and kha of the other are not desired.

original: bri ksha:/ ksha ra ti /
analyzed: bri ksha:/ ksha ra ti /
translated: Bṛkṣa is kṣārati.

original: pa pha dag la mchu can te yang na ma yin no //
analyzed: pa pha dag la mchu can te yang na ma yin no //
translated: In pa and pha, the lips, or not.

original: rnam par gcad bya ni pa pha dag pha rol la mchu can te /
analyzed: rnam par gcad bya ni pa pha dag pha rol la mchu can te /
translated: In the other, pa and pha, the lips,

original: yang na ma yin no //🔽kanypa  ti /🔽ka: pa ti /🔽kanyphal  ti //
analyzed: yang na ma yin no // kanypa  ti / ka: pa ti / kanyphal  ti //
translated: or not.🔽Kañca is pați.🔽Ka and ka are pați.🔽Kañca is phālati.

original: ka: pha la ti //
analyzed: ka: pha la ti //
translated: Ka and kha are phālati.

original: shit pha la can gyi pa pha dag la mi 'dod de /
analyzed: shit pha la can gyi pa pha dag la mi 'dod de /
translated: The fathers of the śitphalas do not desire.

original: aadbhi: ss'a ti //🔽sha sha sa la pha rol gyi gzugs su yang na'o //
analyzed: aadbhi: ss'a ti // sha sha sa la pha rol gyi gzugs su yang na'o //
translated: Adbhiḥ sāsati.🔽In the form of the other, in the śaśa, śaśa, and śāla.

original: rnam par gcad bya sha la 'am sha la 'am sa la pha rol gzugs su 'gyur ti yang na ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par gcad bya sha la 'am sha la 'am sa la pha rol gzugs su 'gyur ti yang na ma yin no //
translated: The object of division is in the form of the other, in the śa, śa, or śāla, or not.

original: 'am gyi sgra gcig ni rgyu mtshan sdud pa la'o //
analyzed: 'am gyi sgra gcig ni rgyu mtshan sdud pa la'o //
translated: One of the words “or” is for collecting the reasons.

original: gzhan ni rnam par brtag pa la'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni rnam par brtag pa la'o //
translated: The other is for considering.

original: @85a * // kashshe te /
analyzed: @85a * // kashshe te /
translated: Kṣaśete.

original: ka:she te / kashsha shtha: ka:kashtha: gass'a dhu: ka s'a dhu: brtsegs pa 'di rnams la pha rol gyi gzugs su mi 'dod de /🔽ka:shtso ta te /
analyzed: ka:she te / kashsha shtha: ka:kashtha: gass'a dhu: ka s'a dhu: brtsegs pa 'di rnams la pha rol gyi gzugs su mi 'dod de / ka:shtso ta te /
translated: Kaśete. Kṣaśaṭhaḥ, ka-kṣaṭhaḥ, ghasādhūḥ, ka-sādhūḥ. These layers are not desired in the form of the other.🔽Kaścotate.

original: ka:shthi w'a ti //
analyzed: ka:shthi w'a ti //
translated: Kaśathi vāti.

original: aa yig dag gi bar du a'u'o //
analyzed: aa yig dag gi bar du a'u'o //
translated: The visarga is between the a syllables.

original: aa yig dag gi zhes pa drug pa'i gnyis kyi tshig go //
analyzed: aa yig dag gi zhes pa drug pa'i gnyis kyi tshig go //
translated: The a syllables are the words of the second of the sixth.

original: aa yig gnyis dag gi bar du gang tsheg drag yod pa de a' nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: aa yig gnyis dag gi bar du gang tsheg drag yod pa de a' nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Whenever there is a visarga between two a syllables, that becomes ā.

original: ko& atra / so& rtha: aa dang sgra ldan dag gi'ang ngo //
analyzed: ko& atra / so& rtha: aa dang sgra ldan dag gi'ang ngo //
translated: Ko, aṃ, atra, so, aṃ, rthaḥ. Of those with a and sound.

original: aa dang sgra ldan te de dag ni aa dang sgra ldan dag go //
analyzed: aa dang sgra ldan te de dag ni aa dang sgra ldan dag go //
translated: They are those that have a and a sound, and those that have a and a sound.

original: aa yig dang sgra ldan dag gi bar gang yin pa der rnam par gcad bya gang yod pa de au nyid du 'thob po ko ga ta /
analyzed: aa yig dang sgra ldan dag gi bar gang yin pa der rnam par gcad bya gang yod pa de au nyid du 'thob po ko ga ta /
translated: The one that is between a and a sound, there, whatever is the object of division, that is obtained as u.

original: yo ngha ba ti /
analyzed: yo ngha ba ti /
translated: ko gat, yo ghaṭi,

original: aa las pha rol dbyangs gzhan la dbyi ba'am yang na ya'o //
analyzed: aa las pha rol dbyangs gzhan la dbyi ba'am yang na ya'o //
translated: After a, another vowel is elided, or ya.

original: aa las pha rol ni aa'i pha rol lo //
analyzed: aa las pha rol ni aa'i pha rol lo //
translated: After a means after ā.

original: gzhan pa yang 'di yin la dbyangs kyang yin pa ni dbyangs gzhan no //
analyzed: gzhan pa yang 'di yin la dbyangs kyang yin pa ni dbyangs gzhan no //
translated: Another means different, and vowel means vowel.

original: aa yig las pha rol gyi rnam par gcad bya aa yig la sogs pa'i dbyangs gzhan pa rol la dbyi bar 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: aa yig las pha rol gyi rnam par gcad bya aa yig la sogs pa'i dbyangs gzhan pa rol la dbyi bar 'gyur ba'am /
translated: After a, the object of division of ā, another vowel different from ā, is elided,

original: yang na ya nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na ya nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: or it becomes ya itself.

original: yang na'i sgra ni bsdu ba la'o //
analyzed: yang na'i sgra ni bsdu ba la'o //
translated: Or is a term of inclusion.

original: sa a'a ha /
analyzed: sa a'a ha /
translated: sa ā ha,

original: sa y'a ba /🔽sa ai ha /
analyzed: sa y'a ba / sa ai ha /
translated: sa yā ba,🔽sa ai ha,

original: sa ye ha /🔽tu dra au pa ri /
analyzed: sa ye ha / tu dra au pa ri /
translated: sa ye ha,🔽tudra u parī,

original: tu dra yu pa ri //
analyzed: tu dra yu pa ri //
translated: tudra yu parī.

original: dbyangs gzhan la zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: dbyangs gzhan la zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: Another vowel means what?

original: ko& rtha: au nyid kyi yul 'di'o zhes pas gzhan smos pa ste /
analyzed: ko& rtha: au nyid kyi yul 'di'o zhes pas gzhan smos pa ste /
translated: ko 'rthaḥ? u eva asya viṣayaḥ. Thus, another is mentioned.🔽 🔽Or is a term of inclusion.

original: bde blag tu rtogs pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: bde blag tu rtogs pa'i don du'o //
translated: for the sake of easy understanding.

original: a' bho dag la dbyangs la de lta nyid do //
analyzed: a' bho dag la dbyangs la de lta nyid do //
translated: In ābhoga, the svarita is just that.

original: aa dang bho ni a' bho dag ste aa yig gi mtha' dang bho'i skra las pha rol gyi rnam par gcad bya dbyangs pha rol la dbyi ba'am ya nyid du 'gyur zhing 'di lta kho na ste sdam la ji lta bzhi du'o //
analyzed: aa dang bho ni a' bho dag ste aa yig gi mtha' dang bho'i skra las pha rol gyi rnam par gcad bya dbyangs pha rol la dbyi ba'am ya nyid du 'gyur zhing 'di lta kho na ste sdam la ji lta bzhi du'o //

original: ai d'um ra ma ti /
analyzed: ai d'um ra ma ti /
translated: idam ramatī

original: 'dir ci'i phyir snga ma ring por mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dir ci'i phyir snga ma ring por mi 'gyur te /
translated: Why is the preceding vowel not long here?🔽auceramat

original: a'utsee ra ma te /
analyzed: a'utsee ra ma te /
translated: goramat

original: goo ra ma te zhes pa las rkan las byung ba dang mchu las byung ba'i aee yig dang au yig dag gi gnas su de 'dra nyid de /
analyzed: goo ra ma te zhes pa las rkan las byung ba dang mchu las byung ba'i aee yig dang au yig dag gi gnas su de 'dra nyid de /
translated: From auceramat and goramat, the ai and au of the palate and lip origins are similar in place, and become ai and au.

original: a'it a'ut dag tu 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: a'it a'ut dag tu 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: They become ṛ and ṝ.

original: bden mod / mtshams sbyor gyi yi ge rnams dang rtagtu ring po nyid kyi phyir ring por mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bden mod / mtshams sbyor gyi yi ge rnams dang rtagtu ring po nyid kyi phyir ring por mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Although that is true, the preceding vowel is not long because the connecting letters are always long.

original: dbyangs las pha rol tsha yig gnyis su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbyangs las pha rol tsha yig gnyis su 'gyur ro //
translated: From a vowel, the two sibilants.

original: lan gnyis dag ni gnyis te /
analyzed: lan gnyis dag ni gnyis te /
translated: Two times two are two.

original: des na gnyis gnyis su 'gyur zhes pa de'i skyes bu'o //
analyzed: des na gnyis gnyis su 'gyur zhes pa de'i skyes bu'o //
translated: Thus, two by two.

original: dbyangs las pha rol gyi tsha yig ni gnyis su 'gyur ba ste ;
analyzed: dbyangs las pha rol gyi tsha yig ni gnyis su 'gyur ba ste ;
translated: From a vowel, the two sibilants become two.

original: gnyis nyid thob bo //
analyzed: gnyis nyid thob bo //
translated: Two is obtained.

original: de watstsha ya /
analyzed: de watstsha ya /
translated: devatsaya.

original: ring po las tshig mtha' la yang na 'dod de /🔽de w'i tstsh'a y'a /
analyzed: ring po las tshig mtha' la yang na 'dod de / de w'i tstsh'a y'a /
translated: From a long vowel, the final letter is also desired.🔽devatsaya.

original: de w'i tsh'a y'a /
analyzed: de w'i tsh'a y'a /
translated: devatsaya.

original: tshig mtha' las zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: tshig mtha' las zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is meant by “from the final letter”?🔽hṛtsati.

original: hritstsha ti // a'ang las pha rol ni rtag tu 'dod de /
analyzed: hritstsha ti // a'ang las pha rol ni rtag tu 'dod de /
translated: From a, the final is always desired.

original: a'atstsha da ya ti //
analyzed: a'atstsha da ya ti //
translated: aṣṭāyate.

original: dbyangs las zhes brjod par bya ba la pha rol smos pa ni dbyangs las pha rol gyi gsal byed ni gsal byed pha rol lam mtshan nyid kyi rjes su 'brang bas gnyis su 'gyur ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: dbyangs las zhes brjod par bya ba la pha rol smos pa ni dbyangs las pha rol gyi gsal byed ni gsal byed pha rol lam mtshan nyid kyi rjes su 'brang bas gnyis su 'gyur ba'i don du'o //
translated: It should be said “from a vowel,” but the term “from a vowel” is stated because the consonant following a vowel is either a consonant following a vowel or a consonant following a characteristic.

original: des na / tsakkram /
analyzed: des na / tsakkram /
translated: Thus, cakraṃ.🔽dadhyatra.

original: daddhya tra / madhyva tra /
analyzed: daddhya tra / madhyva tra /
translated: madhyavatra.

original: jo bo drag 'byor gyis mdzad pa'i grel pa slob ma la phan par mtsham sbyor lnga pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: jo bo drag 'byor gyis mdzad pa'i grel pa slob ma la phan par mtsham sbyor lnga pa rdzogs so /
translated: The commentary composed by the great master Drak-bor, called the Five-Part Commentary Beneficial for Students, is complete.

original: // / tsa w'a h'a aa ha ae wa no ham ho au ta ho ho aa ho aa ton bi t'a dang mi zad pa'o //
analyzed: // / tsa w'a h'a aa ha ae wa no ham ho au ta ho ho aa ho aa ton bi t'a dang mi zad pa'o //
translated: ca vā ha eva no haṃ ho uta ho ho a ha atha vi🔽ca, vā, ha, eva, no, haṃ ho, uta ho, ho, a ha, atha, these are the so-called pāṭas,

original: tsa dang / w'a dang / aa ha dang / ae wa dang / no dang / ham ho dang / au t'a ho dang / ho dang / aa ho dang / aa tho zhes pa so sor dang po'i gcig tshig phyis pa tsa la sogs pa 'di rnams ni p'a ta'i ming can @87a * //🔽du 'gyur te /
analyzed: tsa dang / w'a dang / aa ha dang / ae wa dang / no dang / ham ho dang / au t'a ho dang / ho dang / aa ho dang / aa tho zhes pa so sor dang po'i gcig tshig phyis pa tsa la sogs pa 'di rnams ni p'a ta'i ming can @87a * // du 'gyur te /
translated: which are the first-case singular terminations.

original: mi zad pa'i ming can 'ang ngo //
analyzed: mi zad pa'i ming can 'ang ngo //
translated: They are also called the inexhaustible.

original: ming de dag gang du dgos she na /🔽aot mtha' ni p'a ta rnams dang / aa ai au a' rnams dbyangs la rang bzhin gyis so zhes pa dang / mi zad pa las kyang ngo zhes pa la sogs pa rnams su'o //
analyzed: ming de dag gang du dgos she na / aot mtha' ni p'a ta rnams dang / aa ai au a' rnams dbyangs la rang bzhin gyis so zhes pa dang / mi zad pa las kyang ngo zhes pa la sogs pa rnams su'o //
translated: Where are those names required?

original: no / aa tra ;
analyzed: no / aa tra ;
translated: In such passages as The final o is the pāṭas, and the vowels a, i, u, and ā are naturally the vowels, and Also from the inexhaustible.🔽no

original: aa ho aashtsa r++yam /
analyzed: aa ho aashtsa r++yam /
translated: a ha oṣadhi

original: aa aa pe hi /🔽ai aindram pa shya /
analyzed: aa aa pe hi /🔽ai aindram pa shya /
translated: a a pehi🔽i indraṃ paśya

original: au au ttishtha /
analyzed: au au ttishtha /
translated: U U Tishtha.

original: a' ae wam nu ma n+ya se /
analyzed: a' ae wam nu ma n+ya se /
translated: A E Vam Numannya Se.

original: aod mtha' rnams zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: aod mtha' rnams zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What are the final vowels?

original: brahma na shtse ti /
analyzed: brahma na shtse ti /
translated: Brahmana Shcheti.

original: lji ba'i ming gi byed pa la tsa sogs rnams kyi bsdu ba'i don gco bo la ming 'di 'dod kyi don tsam gtso bo la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: lji ba'i ming gi byed pa la tsa sogs rnams kyi bsdu ba'i don gco bo la ming 'di 'dod kyi don tsam gtso bo la ni ma yin no //
translated: In the function of the name of the case, the meanings of the particles such as ca are collected in the single meaning of connection, but not in the primary meaning.

original: des na gnas ma yin pa la tsa 'di bklags pa ste hi gang gi phyir don no zhes pa la sogs pa la ni ming med do //
analyzed: des na gnas ma yin pa la tsa 'di bklags pa ste hi gang gi phyir don no zhes pa la sogs pa la ni ming med do //
translated: Therefore, this ca is read in the wrong place, because in the meaning of the particle and so on, there is no name.

original: aantar / svar\/ pr'a tar /
analyzed: aantar / svar\/ pr'a tar /
translated: Antar, Svar, Pratar,

original: p'u nar / aa dhar\/
analyzed: p'u nar / aa dhar\/
translated: Punar, Adhar,

original: aa bhi aa har\'o //
analyzed: aa bhi aa har\'o //
translated: Abhi, Ahar.

original: tshig bdun po dang po'i gcig gi tshig phyis pa rnams so //
analyzed: tshig bdun po dang po'i gcig gi tshig phyis pa rnams so //
translated: These are the seven words, the last word of each.

original: aantar dang / svar dang / pra tar dang / pu nar dang / aa dhar dang / aa pi dang / aa har te /
analyzed: aantar dang / svar dang / pra tar dang / pu nar dang / aa dhar dang / aa pi dang / aa har te /
translated: Antar, Svar, Pratar, Punar, Adhar, Abhi, Ahar.

original: 'di rnams ni mi zad pa'i ming can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di rnams ni mi zad pa'i ming can du 'gyur ro //
translated: These become the names of the imperishable ones.

original: ni p'a ta'i ming gi 'brel par bya ba ma yin te dgos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ni p'a ta'i ming gi 'brel par bya ba ma yin te dgos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The name of Ni-pat is not to be connected, because it is purposeless.

original: aa pi ni sdud pa la'o //
analyzed: aa pi ni sdud pa la'o //
translated: Abhi is for collecting.

original: pra pa r'a ni nir aud dur sam bi aa pa aa nu pa ri aa bhi aa nghi pra ti su a'ang aa ti aa pa aa pi au pa nyer bsgyur rnams so //
analyzed: pra pa r'a ni nir aud dur sam bi aa pa aa nu pa ri aa bhi aa nghi pra ti su a'ang aa ti aa pa aa pi au pa nyer bsgyur rnams so //
translated: pra, para, ni, nir, ud, dur, sam, api, ava, anu, pari, abhi, adhi, prati, su, ang, ati, ava, api, upa.

original: au pa zhes pa 'di'i mthar dzas phyis pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: au pa zhes pa 'di'i mthar dzas phyis pa'i tshig go //
translated: This upa is a word that is modified by ja at the end.

original: pra dang pa r'a dang ni dang nir dang aud dang dur dang sam dang pi dang aa ba dang aa nu dang pa ring dang aa bhi dang aa dhi dang pra ti dang su dang a'ang dang aa ti dang aa ba dang aa pi dang au pa zhes
analyzed: pra dang pa r'a dang ni dang nir dang aud dang dur dang sam dang pi dang aa ba dang aa nu dang pa ring dang aa bhi dang aa dhi dang pra ti dang su dang a'ang dang aa ti dang aa ba dang aa pi dang au pa zhes
translated: Pra, para, ni, nir, ud, dur, sam, api, ava, anu, pari, abhi, adhi, prati, su, ang, ati, ava, api, upa.

original: pa 'di rnams nyer bsgyur gyi ming can du 'gyur zhing mi zad pa'i ming yang ngo //
analyzed: pa 'di rnams nyer bsgyur gyi ming can du 'gyur zhing mi zad pa'i ming yang ngo //
translated: These are the names of the indeclinables and also the names of the indeclinables.

original: 'o na nyer bsgyur gyi ming gis mi zad pa'i ming la 'brel lam zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na nyer bsgyur gyi ming gis mi zad pa'i ming la 'brel lam zhe na /
translated: Now, do the names of the indeclinables connect with the names of the indeclinables?

original: bden te mdo snga ma las 'ang rjes su 'jug ste /
analyzed: bden te mdo snga ma las 'ang rjes su 'jug ste /
translated: It is true, but they also follow from the previous sūtra.

original: des na mi zad pa'i ming can du 'ang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na mi zad pa'i ming can du 'ang 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, they are also the names of the indeclinables.

original: nyer bsgyur gyi ming gi gang du dgos she na /
analyzed: nyer bsgyur gyi ming gi gang du dgos she na /
translated: Where are the names of the indeclinables needed?

original: nyer bsgyur la ru las so zhes pa la sogs pa rnams su'o //
analyzed: nyer bsgyur la ru las so zhes pa la sogs pa rnams su'o //
translated: From the prefix ru, from the tree, and so on.

original: sam r'a wa: ru sgra la'o //
analyzed: sam r'a wa: ru sgra la'o //
translated: Samrāvaḥ, from the sound, and so on.

original: sam snga ma'o //
analyzed: sam snga ma'o //
translated: Sam, the former, and so on.

original: yang dag par sgrogs pa'o zhes pas nyer bsgyur la ru las so zhes ghanya'o //
analyzed: yang dag par sgrogs pa'o zhes pas nyer bsgyur la ru las so zhes ghanya'o //
translated: From the prefix ru, to proclaim, and so on.

original: au pa dh'a'i aa zhes pas 'phel ba'o /
analyzed: au pa dh'a'i aa zhes pas 'phel ba'o /
translated: Upadhā, a, and so on.

original: aa nu dang po can rnams las rab tu brjod par bya pa rnams so /
analyzed: aa nu dang po can rnams las rab tu brjod par bya pa rnams so /
translated: From those beginning with anu, the things to be expressed, and so on.

original: dang por @87b yod pa ni dang po'o //
analyzed: dang por @87b yod pa ni dang po'o //
translated: The first is the first.

original: gang rnams kyi dang po aa nu yin pa de rnams ni aa nu la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: gang rnams kyi dang po aa nu yin pa de rnams ni aa nu la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: Those that have anu as the first are anu and so on.

original: aa nu la sogs pa nyer bsgyur bcu gcig gang sngar brjod pa de rnams ni /
analyzed: aa nu la sogs pa nyer bsgyur bcu gcig gang sngar brjod pa de rnams ni /
translated: The eleven prefixes beginning with anu, which were mentioned previously, are

original: las rab tu brjod par bya ba'i ming can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las rab tu brjod par bya ba'i ming can du 'gyur ro //
translated: called the names of the things to be expressed.

original: las rab tu brjod par bya ba'i ming gis gang du dgos she na /
analyzed: las rab tu brjod par bya ba'i ming gis gang du dgos she na /
translated: By what name is the thing to be expressed required?

original: las rab tu brjod pa rnams kyis kyang ngo zhes pa 'di 'dor ro //
analyzed: las rab tu brjod pa rnams kyis kyang ngo zhes pa 'di 'dor ro //
translated: Also by the things to be expressed, this is rejected.

original: briksham briksha ma nu si tsa ti /
analyzed: briksham briksha ma nu si tsa ti /
translated: Brikṣam, brikṣam, anus, catī.

original: pha rol gyi bya ba la dang po rnam par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: pha rol gyi bya ba la dang po rnam par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: In the action of another, the first.

original: pha rol gyi bya ba la ni dang po'i yi ge rnam par 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: pha rol gyi bya ba la ni dang po'i yi ge rnam par 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: In the action of another, the first letter is changed.

original: de'i bsgyur bar 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de'i bsgyur bar 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don to //
translated: It is changed, is the meaning.

original: a'a s'i n'a /
analyzed: a'a s'i n'a /
translated: Ā, in the locative.

original: aas nye bar sngod pa la'o //
analyzed: aas nye bar sngod pa la'o //
translated: Ā is used for the ablative.

original: da ltar ba la shantring zhes pa a' na sha'o //🔽aan bi ka ra na ste aad sogs las 'jig go //
analyzed: da ltar ba la shantring zhes pa a' na sha'o // aan bi ka ra na ste aad sogs las 'jig go //
translated: In the present, aṇ is used.🔽Aṇ is used for the ablative.

original: a'as las de'i a'i'o zhes pas a'an sha'i dang po a'i yig tu bsgyur ba'o //
analyzed: a'as las de'i a'i'o zhes pas a'an sha'i dang po a'i yig tu bsgyur ba'o //
translated: The first letter of aṇ is changed to ā.

original: snga ma'i bya ba la mtha' na yod pa 'dod do //
analyzed: snga ma'i bya ba la mtha' na yod pa 'dod do //
translated: The final is accepted in the action of the former.

original: mtha' na yod pa ni mthar yod do //
analyzed: mtha' na yod pa ni mthar yod do //
translated: The final is at the end.

original: snga ma'i bya ba byed pa la mtha' na yod pa'i yi ge rnam par 'gyur bar 'dod de /🔽tyad la sogs pa'i mtha'i da yig gi bsgyur bar 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: snga ma'i bya ba byed pa la mtha' na yod pa'i yi ge rnam par 'gyur bar 'dod de / tyad la sogs pa'i mtha'i da yig gi bsgyur bar 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The final letter is changed in the action of the former.🔽The final da of aṇ is changed, is the meaning.🔽The final a of aṇ is changed.

original: sa:/ ya:/ tyad la sogs pa rnams kyi rnam dbye la zhes pas mtha'i aa yig go //
analyzed: sa:/ ya:/ tyad la sogs pa rnams kyi rnam dbye la zhes pas mtha'i aa yig go //
translated: The final a of aṇ is changed.

original: kha cig tu snga ma dang pha rol dag thams cad do //🔽sda ma dang phyi ma thams cad dag kha cig tu rnam 'gyur du 'gyur gyi thams cad du ma yin no //
analyzed: kha cig tu snga ma dang pha rol dag thams cad do // sda ma dang phyi ma thams cad dag kha cig tu rnam 'gyur du 'gyur gyi thams cad du ma yin no //
translated: In some cases, the former and the latter are all.🔽In some cases, the former and the latter are all. In some cases, the former and the latter are all.

original: kha cig tu snga ma thams cad rnam par 'gyur ba ni /
analyzed: kha cig tu snga ma thams cad rnam par 'gyur ba ni /
translated: In some cases, the former is all.

original: ai ta ai ha /🔽de la ai dma ai'o zhes pas ai dam thams cad ai nyid do //
analyzed: ai ta ai ha / de la ai dma ai'o zhes pas ai dam thams cad ai nyid do //
translated: iti iti

original: kha cig tu phyi ma thams cad rnam par 'gyur ba ni /
analyzed: kha cig tu phyi ma thams cad rnam par 'gyur ba ni /
translated: In this case, the former is all.

original: aashtatishtha / aashtoo pa shya /
analyzed: aashtatishtha / aashtoo pa shya /
translated: aṣṭa ṣaṣṭhaḥ aṣṭau paśya

original: de las rdzas shas dag gi aoo zhes pas dzas shas thams cad aoo nyid do //
analyzed: de las rdzas shas dag gi aoo zhes pas dzas shas thams cad aoo nyid do //
translated: In this case, the former is all.

original: sbyor ba sgrub pa na 'brang bar bya'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba sgrub pa na 'brang bar bya'o //
translated: The application is to be followed in the proof.

original: sbyor ba mdo'i sgrub pa ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba mdo'i sgrub pa ste /
translated: The application is the proof of the sutra.

original: nges par sgrub par byed pa gang 'dir ma brjod pa de ni mchog gi sbyor ba'i rjes su 'brang bas bstan bcom gzhan la 'brang bar bya ste rjes su 'brang bar bya'o //
analyzed: nges par sgrub par byed pa gang 'dir ma brjod pa de ni mchog gi sbyor ba'i rjes su 'brang bas bstan bcom gzhan la 'brang bar bya ste rjes su 'brang bar bya'o //
translated: What is not stated here in the proof is to be followed by the supreme application, and should be followed by following another teaching.

original: 'jig rten pa'i nye bar spyod pa las zhes pa 'di kho na'i spros pa 'di'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i nye bar spyod pa las zhes pa 'di kho na'i spros pa 'di'o //
translated: This is the only elaboration from the worldly enjoyments.

original: jo bo drag 'byor gyis mdzad pa'i 'gral pa slob ma la phan par n'i pa ta'i skabs te drug pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: jo bo drag 'byor gyis mdzad pa'i 'gral pa slob ma la phan par n'i pa ta'i skabs te drug pa rdzogs so /
translated: The sixth chapter of the Student's Textbook composed by the venerable Drak-ö is complete.

original: // / mtshams sbyor gyi rab tu byed pa rnams rdzogs so /
analyzed: // / mtshams sbyor gyi rab tu byed pa rnams rdzogs so /
translated: The introductory chapters are complete.

original: // / byings dang rnam dbye bor ba'i @88a * //
analyzed: // / byings dang rnam dbye bor ba'i @88a * //
translated: The meanings of the roots and the cases

original: don dang ldan pa rtags so //
analyzed: don dang ldan pa rtags so //
translated: are endowed with the affix.

original: byings rnams dang rnam dbye rnams te de rnams ni byings dang rnam dbye'o //
analyzed: byings rnams dang rnam dbye rnams te de rnams ni byings dang rnam dbye'o //
translated: The roots and the cases, those are the roots and the cases.

original: bri dzi las tsu ra la sogs pa nyid kyi phyir aina'o //
analyzed: bri dzi las tsu ra la sogs pa nyid kyi phyir aina'o //
translated: Because of the cu-ra and so forth from the bri-dzi, the ai is added.

original: yon tan no /
analyzed: yon tan no /
translated: The quality.

original: dor bar bya'o zhes pas dor ba se dbyangs dang bri tri ga mi gra ha rnams kyi aa la'o //
analyzed: dor bar bya'o zhes pas dor ba se dbyangs dang bri tri ga mi gra ha rnams kyi aa la'o //
translated: Since it is said is to be discarded, the discard is the a of the bri-tri-ga-mi-gra-ha.

original: k'a ri ta dbyi'o ;
analyzed: k'a ri ta dbyi'o ;
translated: The ka-ri-ta is the root.

original: / don dang ldan pa gang du byings dang rnam dbye dor ba zhes tshig rnams par sbyar ro //
analyzed: / don dang ldan pa gang du byings dang rnam dbye dor ba zhes tshig rnams par sbyar ro //
translated: The meanings of the roots and the cases are endowed with the affix, the words are connected.

original: 'di la don yod pa'o zhes pa don dang ldan pa ste 'di la yod pa zhes pas wantu'o //
analyzed: 'di la don yod pa'o zhes pa don dang ldan pa ste 'di la yod pa zhes pas wantu'o //
translated: Here, it has a purpose is arthavat, it has meaning. It exists is asti.

original: rdzogs pa dang gsal byed dang po la zhes pas aa nu sham ga dbyi'o //
analyzed: rdzogs pa dang gsal byed dang po la zhes pas aa nu sham ga dbyi'o //
translated: The first of the augmentations and the vibhaktis is anuśāman.

original: sgra brjod pas gang rtogs par bya ba de ni 'dir don gyi sgras brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: sgra brjod pas gang rtogs par bya ba de ni 'dir don gyi sgras brjod par bya'o //
translated: That which is to be understood by the expression of a word is to be expressed here by the word artha.

original: don dang ldan pa don dang bcas pa'i sgra'i ngo bo ni rtags kyi ming can du 'gyur te /
analyzed: don dang ldan pa don dang bcas pa'i sgra'i ngo bo ni rtags kyi ming can du 'gyur te /
translated: The nature of a word that has a purpose, that has meaning, is a nominal affix.

original: byings dang rnam dbyed dang bral ba zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: byings dang rnam dbyed dang bral ba zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is free from a verbal root and a vibhakti.

original: rtags kyi mings gang du dgos she na /
analyzed: rtags kyi mings gang du dgos she na /
translated: If it is asked, Where is a nominal affix required?

original: rtags mtha'i na yig gi'o zhes pa la sogs pa rnams su'o //
analyzed: rtags mtha'i na yig gi'o zhes pa la sogs pa rnams su'o //
translated: It is in such [expressions] as at the end of the affix na.

original: r'a dz'a / byings dang rnam dbye dor ba ci zhe na ;
analyzed: r'a dz'a / byings dang rnam dbye dor ba ci zhe na ;
translated: If it is asked, Why is the verbal root and the vibhakti discarded?

original: bh'ashya te / ku le /
analyzed: bh'ashya te / ku le /
translated: It is said: kula.

original: gal te bhasha rtags kyi ming can du 'gyur na ha shasha tsha mtha' zhes pas da nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te bhasha rtags kyi ming can du 'gyur na ha shasha tsha mtha' zhes pas da nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If bhas becomes a nominal affix, it would be just that by at the end of ha śa.

original: ku le zhes pa 'dir dbyangs thung ngu zhes pas ae gig gi thung ngu ai yig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ku le zhes pa 'dir dbyangs thung ngu zhes pas ae gig gi thung ngu ai yig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: The word kulyā is here short vowel [in the Kātantra], so the short of a single e becomes the i vowel.

original: don dang ldan pa zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: don dang ldan pa zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is having a meaning?

original: briksha:zhes pa 'di cha shas don med pa rnams ming du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: briksha:zhes pa 'di cha shas don med pa rnams ming du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The word bṛkṣa is not a name, because its parts have no meaning.

original: de las phyi ma rnam dbye'o //🔽si / aoo /🔽dzas\/ aam / aoo /
analyzed: de las phyi ma rnam dbye'o // si / aoo / dzas\/ aam / aoo /
translated: The last of those is a case ending.🔽si [is the case ending for] the genitive.🔽The word jas [is the case ending for] the vocative.

original: shas\/ t'a / bhy'am\/🔽bhis\/ de bhy'am /🔽bhyas / nga si /
analyzed: shas\/ t'a / bhy'am\/ bhis\/ de bhy'am / bhyas / nga si /
translated: The word śas [is the case ending for] the ablative.🔽The word bhis [is the case ending for] the locative.🔽The word bhyas [is the case ending for] the dative.🔽The word as [is the case ending for] the instrumental.🔽The word tas [is the case ending for] the ablative.

original: bhy'am / ngas\/ aos\/🔽a'am\/ di / aos\/
analyzed: bhy'am / ngas\/ aos\/ a'am\/ di / aos\/
translated: The word tas [is the case ending for] the locative.

original: su pa rnams so //
analyzed: su pa rnams so //
translated: The word su [is the case ending for] the dative.

original: si la sogs pa rnams zlas dbye ba'o //
analyzed: si la sogs pa rnams zlas dbye ba'o //
translated: The words si and so on are the case endings.

original: 'di ni dzas\ byis pa'ang ngo //
analyzed: 'di ni dzas\ byis pa'ang ngo //
translated: This is jas [the case ending for] the vocative.

original: rtags de las phyi ma'i si la sogs pa rnams rnam dbyer 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtags de las phyi ma'i si la sogs pa rnams rnam dbyer 'gyur ro //
translated: The last of those, si and so on, become case endings.

original: si la sogs pa 'di rnams kyi nang nas /
analyzed: si la sogs pa 'di rnams kyi nang nas /
translated: Among these si and so on,

original: si ao dzas\ zhes pa dang po'o //🔽aam\ aoo shas\ zhes pa gnyis pa'o //🔽t'a bhy'am bhis zhes pa gsum pa'o //
analyzed: si ao dzas\ zhes pa dang po'o // aam\ aoo shas\ zhes pa gnyis pa'o // t'a bhy'am bhis zhes pa gsum pa'o //
translated: si [is the case ending for] the genitive.🔽The word as [is the case ending for] the vocative.🔽The word tas [is the case ending for] the ablative.

original: de bhy'am\ bhy'as\ zhes pa zhin pa'o //
analyzed: de bhy'am\ bhy'as\ zhes pa zhin pa'o //
translated: The word bhyas [is the case ending for] the dative.

original: ngasi bhy'am\ bhy'as zhes pa lnga pa'o //
analyzed: ngasi bhy'am\ bhy'as zhes pa lnga pa'o //
translated: The fifth is “asmai” or “asmai”.

original: nga\s aos\ a'am\ zhes pa drug pa'o //
analyzed: nga\s aos\ a'am\ zhes pa drug pa'o //
translated: The sixth is “asya” or “asya”.

original: di aos sup ces pa bdun pa'o //
analyzed: di aos sup ces pa bdun pa'o //
translated: The seventh is “asya” or “asya”.

original: si la sogs pa rnams kyi dang po la sogs pa'i ming ni sngon gyi slob dpon gyi tha snyad las so //🔽briksh'a:/ brikshoo / briksh'a: briksham\/🔽brikshoo / brikshan\/ brikshen /
analyzed: si la sogs pa rnams kyi dang po la sogs pa'i ming ni sngon gyi slob dpon gyi tha snyad las so // briksh'a:/ brikshoo / briksh'a: briksham\/ brikshoo / brikshan\/ brikshen /
translated: The names of the first, etc. of the sibilants, etc. are from the usage of the former masters.🔽bṛkṣāḥ, bṛkṣau, bṛkṣāṇi, bṛkṣe.🔽bṛkṣau, bṛkṣau, bṛkṣe, bṛkṣe.

original: briksha bhy'am\/ brikshee:/ briksh'a ya /
analyzed: briksha bhy'am\/ brikshee:/ briksh'a ya /
translated: bṛkṣābhyāṃ, bṛkṣābhyāṃ, bṛkṣābhyāṃ, bṛkṣābhyāṃ.

original: briksh'a bhy'am\/ brikshe bhya:briksh'at /🔽@88b briksha bhy'ama /🔽brikshe bhya:/ briksha sya /🔽briksha yo: briksh'a n'am /
analyzed: briksh'a bhy'am\/ brikshe bhya:briksh'at / @88b briksha bhy'ama / brikshe bhya:/ briksha sya / briksha yo: briksh'a n'am /
translated: bṛkṣābhyāṃ, bṛkṣābhyāṃ, bṛkṣābhyāṃ, bṛkṣābhyāṃ.🔽bṛkṣābhyāṃ, bṛkṣābhyāṃ, bṛkṣābhyāṃ, bṛkṣābhyāṃ.🔽bṛkṣābhyāṃ, bṛkṣābhyāṃ, bṛkṣābhyāṃ, bṛkṣābhyāṃ.🔽bṛkṣābhyāṃ, bṛkṣābhyāṃ, bṛkṣābhyāṃ, bṛkṣābhyāṃ.

original: brikshe / briksha yo: brikshe shu /
analyzed: brikshe / briksha yo: brikshe shu /
translated: bṛkṣābhyāṃ, bṛkṣābhyāṃ, bṛkṣābhyāṃ, bṛkṣābhyāṃ.

original: de las smos pa ni 'di nas rtags kyi dbang du byas pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: de las smos pa ni 'di nas rtags kyi dbang du byas pa'i don du'o //
translated: The mention of this is for the purpose of the meaning based on the sign from here.

original: rkyen phyi ma'o zhes pas phyi ma nyid thob pa la phyi ma smos pa ni rnam pa gsal ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: rkyen phyi ma'o zhes pas phyi ma nyid thob pa la phyi ma smos pa ni rnam pa gsal ba'i don du'o //
translated: The mention of the latter is for the purpose of clarifying the aspect, since the latter itself is obtained by the statement of the latter condition.

original: ti la sogs pa dang 'dra bar si la sogs pa rnams la rnam dbye'i tha snyad grub na'ang /
analyzed: ti la sogs pa dang 'dra bar si la sogs pa rnams la rnam dbye'i tha snyad grub na'ang /
translated: Just as with ta and so on, the case endings are formed for sa and so on.

original: rnam dbye smos pa ni aa yig ring po zhes pa la sogs pa la nye bar mkho ba'o don du'o //
analyzed: rnam dbye smos pa ni aa yig ring po zhes pa la sogs pa la nye bar mkho ba'o don du'o //
translated: But the mention of the case endings is for the sake of the long ā vowel and so on.

original: dang po lnga ghuta'o //
analyzed: dang po lnga ghuta'o //
translated: The first five are ghu.

original: si la sogs pa rnams rjes su 'jug go //
analyzed: si la sogs pa rnams rjes su 'jug go //
translated: Sa and so on are added.

original: si la sogs pa rnams kyi dang po rkyen lnga gang yin pa de rnams ghu ta'i ming can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: si la sogs pa rnams kyi dang po rkyen lnga gang yin pa de rnams ghu ta'i ming can du 'gyur ro //
translated: Whatever the five conditions are of the first of sa and so on, they become named ghu.

original: si aoo dzas\ aam\ aoo /
analyzed: si aoo dzas\ aam\ aoo /
translated: Sa o jaṃ aṃ oṃ.

original: ghuta'i ming gong du dgos she na /
analyzed: ghuta'i ming gong du dgos she na /
translated: Why is the name ghu needed above?

original: ghu ta la'ang sam buddh'i min pa la'o zhes pa la sogs pa rnams su'o //
analyzed: ghu ta la'ang sam buddh'i min pa la'o zhes pa la sogs pa rnams su'o //
translated: It is also for ghu, as in sambuddha and so on.

original: r'a dz'a / r'a dz'a noo /
analyzed: r'a dz'a / r'a dz'a noo /
translated: Rāja, rājāno,

original: r'a dz'a noo /🔽r'a dz'a n'a:/ r'a dz'a nam /
analyzed: r'a dz'a noo / r'a dz'a n'a:/ r'a dz'a nam /
translated: rājāno,🔽rājānām, rājānaṃ,

original: r'a dz'a noo /
analyzed: r'a dz'a noo /
translated: rājāno.

original: lnga rnams zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: lnga rnams zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: r'a dzny'a: pa shya shas so //
analyzed: r'a dzny'a: pa shya shas so //
translated: Rājñā, paśya śaḥ.

original: ba ma brtsegs pa ma yin pa las zhes pas aa yig dbyi'o //
analyzed: ba ma brtsegs pa ma yin pa las zhes pas aa yig dbyi'o //
translated: Since it is not a stacked ba, the ā vowel is long.

original: ci ste rnam dbye lnga rnams kyi ming du ci'i phyir mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci ste rnam dbye lnga rnams kyi ming du ci'i phyir mi 'gyur te /
translated: Why would they not be names of the five cases?

original: sa khi t'a sogs las aagni ma yin no zhes pa'i mdo brtsams pa las so //
analyzed: sa khi t'a sogs las aagni ma yin no zhes pa'i mdo brtsams pa las so //
translated: The sutra begins with sakhitah, not agnitah.

original: rnam dbye rnams kyi ming yin par gyur na sa khi'i sgra'i t'a dang de dag pha rol la ae nyid du bya pa na aagni'i ming can gyi bya ba med par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir dgag pa 'bras bu med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam dbye rnams kyi ming yin par gyur na sa khi'i sgra'i t'a dang de dag pha rol la ae nyid du bya pa na aagni'i ming can gyi bya ba med par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir dgag pa 'bras bu med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If they were names of the cases, then when the ta of the word sakhi is changed to e in the feminine, the action named agni would not be absent.

original: ma ning la dzas shas dag go //
analyzed: ma ning la dzas shas dag go //
translated: The letters jsa are for the neuter.

original: dzas\ shas zhes pa 'di dag ma ning gi yul la ghuta'i ming can du 'gyur ro //🔽s'a m'an pa thanti /
analyzed: dzas\ shas zhes pa 'di dag ma ning gi yul la ghuta'i ming can du 'gyur ro // s'a m'an pa thanti /
translated: These letters jsa become the name ghuṭa for the object of the neuter.🔽Samānapāntam

original: s'a m'a ni pashya /
analyzed: s'a m'a ni pashya /
translated: Samānapāśyam

original: dzas\ la ming grub kyang slar yang nye bar len pa ni nges pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: dzas\ la ming grub kyang slar yang nye bar len pa ni nges pa'i don du'o //
translated: Although the name is formed with jsa, the suffix is again for the sake of specification.

original: des na ma ning la dzas\ shas\ dag ghuta'i ming can te gzhan la ma yin no //
analyzed: des na ma ning la dzas\ shas\ dag ghuta'i ming can te gzhan la ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the letters jsa are the name ghuṭa for the neuter, not for others.

original: s'a ma n'i /
analyzed: s'a ma n'i /
translated: Samāninī

original: be ma n'i /
analyzed: be ma n'i /
translated: Vemaninī

original: bod pa la si sambuddhi'o //
analyzed: bod pa la si sambuddhi'o //
translated: The Tibetan is Sambuddhi.

original: 'bod par byed pa ni bod pa ste /🔽bod pa'i don la si gang yin pa de sam buddhi'i ming can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bod par byed pa ni bod pa ste / bod pa'i don la si gang yin pa de sam buddhi'i ming can du 'gyur ro //
translated: The causative is the one who causes to speak.🔽The meaning of the causative is the one who has the name of the Sambudi.

original: sambuddhi'i ming gang du dgos she na /
analyzed: sambuddhi'i ming gang du dgos she na /
translated: Where is the name of the Sambudi needed?

original: sambuddhi la'ang ngo zhes pa la sogs pa rnams su'o ;
analyzed: sambuddhi la'ang ngo zhes pa la sogs pa rnams su'o ;
translated: In such words as Sambudilam.🔽What is the meaning of the causative?🔽The causative is the one who causes to do.

original: / he gam ge / bod pa la zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: / he gam ge / bod pa la zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: The causative is the one who causes to do.

original: gam g'a / a' ga ma aud rjes su 'brel pa dbyangs mtha' las pha rol du'o //
analyzed: gam g'a / a' ga ma aud rjes su 'brel pa dbyangs mtha' las pha rol du'o //
translated: The causative is the one who causes to do.

original: a' ga ma gang ma aud rjes su 'brel pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: a' ga ma gang ma aud rjes su 'brel pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The causative is the one who causes to do.🔽The causative is the one who causes to do.🔽The causative is the one who causes to do.🔽The causative is the one who causes to do.🔽The causative is the one who causes to do.

original: 'di ni sbyir ba btang ba ste nge pa med pa ma nges pa ni spyir btang ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sbyir ba btang ba ste nge pa med pa ma nges pa ni spyir btang ba'o //
translated: The causative is the one who causes to do.

original: au yig rjes @89a * //🔽su 'brel pa'i a' ga ma rtags kyi dbyangs kyi mtha' las pha rol du 'gyur ro zhes yongs su bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: au yig rjes @89a * // su 'brel pa'i a' ga ma rtags kyi dbyangs kyi mtha' las pha rol du 'gyur ro zhes yongs su bshad par bya'o //
translated: The causative is the one who causes to do.

original: si la nu'o //🔽aa na dv'a na /
analyzed: si la nu'o // aa na dv'a na /
translated: The causative is the one who causes to do.

original: gsum pa la sogs pa ni phyi ma'i dang por ro //
analyzed: gsum pa la sogs pa ni phyi ma'i dang por ro //
translated: The causative is the one who causes to do.🔽The causative is the one who causes to do.🔽The causative is the one who causes to do.🔽The causative is the one who causes to do.🔽The causative is the one who causes to do.🔽The causative is the one who causes to do.🔽The causative is the one who causes to do.🔽The causative is the one who causes to do.🔽The causative is the one who causes to do.🔽The causative is the one who causes to do.🔽The causative is the one who causes to do.🔽The causative is the one who causes to do.🔽The causative is the one who causes to do.🔽The causative is the one who causes to do.🔽The causative is the one who causes to do.🔽The causative is the one who causes to do.🔽The causative is the one who causes to do.🔽The causative is the one who causes to do.🔽The causative is the one who causes to do.🔽The causative is the one who causes to do.🔽The causative is the one who causes to do.🔽The causative is the one who causes to do.🔽The causative is the one who causes to do.🔽The causative is the one who causes to do.🔽The causative is the one who causes to do.🔽The causative is the one who causes to do.🔽The causative is the one who causes to do.🔽The causative is the one who causes to do.🔽The causative is the one who causes to do.🔽The causative is the one who causes to do.

original: rnam dbye'i tshogs gang gi dang po gsum pa yin pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: rnam dbye'i tshogs gang gi dang po gsum pa yin pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The first and third of the group of the vibhaktis are to be supplied in the sentence.

original: phyi ma'i thog ma ni phyi ma'i dang po'o //
analyzed: phyi ma'i thog ma ni phyi ma'i dang po'o //
translated: The first of the latter is the first of the following.

original: gsum pa la sogs pa'i rnam dbye'i tshogs yod na a' ga ma aud rjes su 'brel pa phyi ma'i rkyen gyi dang por 'gyur zhing phyi ma'i cha shas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsum pa la sogs pa'i rnam dbye'i tshogs yod na a' ga ma aud rjes su 'brel pa phyi ma'i rkyen gyi dang por 'gyur zhing phyi ma'i cha shas su 'gyur ro //
translated: When there is a group of vibhaktis beginning with the third, the following āgama is the first of the condition of the following and is a part of the following.

original: de'i nang du lhung ba ni de smos pas gzung bar bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de'i nang du lhung ba ni de smos pas gzung bar bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: That which falls within it is to be taken by mentioning it.

original: snga mas rtags kyi cha shas nyid thob pa la 'dis rkyen gyi cha thas nyid du nges par bya'o //🔽thams cad las a'am\ la su'o //
analyzed: snga mas rtags kyi cha shas nyid thob pa la 'dis rkyen gyi cha thas nyid du nges par bya'o // thams cad las a'am\ la su'o //
translated: Having obtained the part of the reason by the former, by this one should ascertain the part of the condition.🔽From all, am or asu.

original: sarbe sh'am\/ sarba s'am\/
analyzed: sarbe sh'am\/ sarba s'am\/
translated: Sarveṣām, sarvasām,

original: su a'a ga ma pha rol gyi dang po nyid yin na nghu ta mang po nyid la ni ae'o zhes pas ae nyid du grub bo //
analyzed: su a'a ga ma pha rol gyi dang po nyid yin na nghu ta mang po nyid la ni ae'o zhes pas ae nyid du grub bo //
translated: If the first of the following is su, then by the rule e bahuvacane bahuvacana eva, e itself is established.

original: aitra aut aagni'o //
analyzed: aitra aut aagni'o //
translated: Itra, uta, agni.

original: yi ge smos pa na de'i mtha'i sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: yi ge smos pa na de'i mtha'i sgrub pa'o //
translated: When a syllable is mentioned, it is the suffix of that.

original: gang du dgos she na /
analyzed: gang du dgos she na /
translated: Where is it necessary?

original: ait aut ces pas ai yig dang au yig dag gis ai aig dang au yig mtha' can dag gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: ait aut ces pas ai yig dang au yig dag gis ai aig dang au yig mtha' can dag gzung bar bya ste /
translated: The words ita uta include the letters i and u and those that end in i and u.

original: ai yig mtha' can dang au yig mtha' can ni aagni'i ming can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ai yig mtha' can dang au yig mtha' can ni aagni'i ming can du 'gyur ro //
translated: Those that end in i and those that end in u become the names of agni.

original: aagni'i ming gang du dgos she na /
analyzed: aagni'i ming gang du dgos she na /
translated: Where is the name agni needed?

original: aagni las aa ma'i aa yig go zhes pa la sogs pa rnams su'o //
analyzed: aagni las aa ma'i aa yig go zhes pa la sogs pa rnams su'o //
translated: In the words agninā, amīnām, agne, and so on.

original: aagnim\/ patum\/ ta pha rol du byed pa ni the tshom med pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: aagnim\/ patum\/ ta pha rol du byed pa ni the tshom med pa'i don du'o //
translated: Agni means to make go to the other side, in the sense of without doubt.🔽In the feminine expressions, āiti and āuti, the first two are reversed.

original: a'it\ a'ut\ bud med brjod pa dag na d'i'o /
analyzed: a'it\ a'ut\ bud med brjod pa dag na d'i'o /
translated: The feminine expressions are āiti and āuti.

original: a'it a'ut ces pa dang po'i gnyis kyi tshig phyis pa'o //
analyzed: a'it a'ut ces pa dang po'i gnyis kyi tshig phyis pa'o //
translated: In the feminine expressions, āiti and āuti, the first two are reversed.

original: bud med 'chad pa ni bud med brjod pa'o //🔽tsakshing\ las stri dang a'ang zhes pa de dag sngon du'o //
analyzed: bud med 'chad pa ni bud med brjod pa'o // tsakshing\ las stri dang a'ang zhes pa de dag sngon du'o //
translated: The feminine expressions are āiti and āuti.

original: tsakshida\'i khy'anya\'o zhes pas khy'anya\ ru bsgyur ro //
analyzed: tsakshida\'i khy'anya\'o zhes pas khy'anya\ ru bsgyur ro //
translated: In the feminine expressions, āiti and āuti, the first two are reversed.

original: m'u la bi bhu dzi la sogs pa rnams las kyang ngo zhes pas ka'i rken no //
analyzed: m'u la bi bhu dzi la sogs pa rnams las kyang ngo zhes pas ka'i rken no //
translated: The feminine expressions are āiti and āuti.

original: byings thams cad ma yin pa la aa dbyi'o zhes pas aa yig dbyi'o //
analyzed: byings thams cad ma yin pa la aa dbyi'o zhes pas aa yig dbyi'o //
translated: The feminine is not all nouns, but those that end in a or au.

original: a'i yig dad a'u yig mtha' can gyi sgra bud med brjod pa ste bud med 'chad par byed pa dag na d'i'i ming can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: a'i yig dad a'u yig mtha' can gyi sgra bud med brjod pa ste bud med 'chad par byed pa dag na d'i'i ming can du 'gyur ro //
translated: The feminine is expressed by the letter a and the letter au.

original: na d'i'i ming gis gang du dgos she na /
analyzed: na d'i'i ming gis gang du dgos she na /
translated: Where is the feminine required by the name nadi?

original: na d'i las aee a'as a'as a'am\'o zhes pa la sogs pa rnams su'o //
analyzed: na d'i las aee a'as a'as a'am\'o zhes pa la sogs pa rnams su'o //
translated: In the words ai, ai, ai, ai, etc.

original: nadyee / nadhyee /
analyzed: nadyee / nadhyee /
translated: Nadi, nadi.

original: ait\ a'ut\ ces pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: ait\ a'ut\ ces pa ci zhe na /
translated: What about the words it, ut?🔽The feminine is to be expressed in matre.

original: matre / @89b bud med la zhes brjod bar bya ba la brjod pa smos pa ni rtag tu bud med kyi yul yin pa cig na ng'i'i ming can gyi don no //
analyzed: matre / @89b bud med la zhes brjod bar bya ba la brjod pa smos pa ni rtag tu bud med kyi yul yin pa cig na ng'i'i ming can gyi don no //
translated: The mention of expression is for the purpose of always having a feminine object, but the meaning of the feminine name is not.

original: des na 'dir mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na 'dir mi 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, it does not apply here.

original: gr'a ma nye sti ya /
analyzed: gr'a ma nye sti ya /
translated: Gramanī, neti.

original: y'a ba lve sti ye /
analyzed: y'a ba lve sti ye /
translated: Yāvalī, neti.

original: gr'ama n'i dang / ya ba l'u'i sgra 'di dag rtag tu bud med kyi yul can ma yin te skyes pa la yang 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gr'ama n'i dang / ya ba l'u'i sgra 'di dag rtag tu bud med kyi yul can ma yin te skyes pa la yang 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: These words gramanī and yāvalī are not always feminine, because they are used for males as well.

original: a'iy\ au wa\'i gnas su gyur pa'i bud med brjod pa ni na d'i'i ming can du mi 'dod de sti'i sgra ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: a'iy\ au wa\'i gnas su gyur pa'i bud med brjod pa ni na d'i'i ming can du mi 'dod de sti'i sgra ma gtogs pa'o //

original: he shr'i:/ he bhr'u:/
analyzed: he shr'i:/ he bhr'u:/

original: sam buddhi la thung ngu dang dbyi ba dag mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sam buddhi la thung ngu dang dbyi ba dag mi 'gyur ro //

analyzed: thung ngu na d'i shraddha rnams las si dbyi'o zhes pas stri'i sgra'i he sti zhes pa 'di ltar 'gyur ro ;

analyzed: shraddh'a'i ming gang du dgos she na /

analyzed: ki ri ta dbyi'o //

analyzed: des na bha wadbhy'am /

analyzed: shasha sa ha'o //

analyzed: aa yig sgra ldan la ring po'o //

translated: The letter j is added to the word “other” (anya), and the word “not” (na) is added to the word “all” (sarva).🔽The letter j at the end of a word that ends in a vowel is lengthened.

translated: The sign ending in the letter a causes the other side to be changed to the condition of i in īṇ.🔽devīnā

original: de we na /🔽de ni ya'o //
analyzed: de we na / de ni ya'o //
translated: ta yā

original: aa yig mtha' can gyi rtags las pha rol gyi nge'i rkyen ya yig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: aa yig mtha' can gyi rtags las pha rol gyi nge'i rkyen ya yig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: The sign ending in the letter a causes the other side to be changed to the condition of y in ya.

original: de w'a ya /
analyzed: de w'a ya /

original: de zhes pa bdun pa'i gcig gi tshig 'dzin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de zhes pa bdun pa'i gcig gi tshig 'dzin pa ma yin te /

original: dhu ti ba hu tve tve zhes pa'i shes par byed pa las so //
analyzed: dhu ti ba hu tve tve zhes pa'i shes par byed pa las so //
translated: From the causative dhūtvā, veti.

original: sarba n'a ma las smee'o //
analyzed: sarba n'a ma las smee'o //
translated: From all names, me.

original: aa yig mtha' can thams cad pa'i ming las pha rol gyi de'i rkyen smee ru bsgyur bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: aa yig mtha' can thams cad pa'i ming las pha rol gyi de'i rkyen smee ru bsgyur bar 'gyur te /
translated: From all names ending in the letter a, the condition of the other becomes me.

original: ya nyid 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: ya nyid 'gog pa'o //
translated: The very ya is prohibited.

original: sarba smee / bi shvasmee /
analyzed: sarba smee / bi shvasmee /
translated: Sarva me, viśva me.

original: aa yig gi mtha' las zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: aa yig gi mtha' las zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is meant by “ending in the letter a”?

original: bha ba ste /
analyzed: bha ba ste /

analyzed: sarba la sogs pa'i ming du gyur par rnam ni sarba'i ming can du bshad par bya ba ma yin te /

analyzed: des na 'dir mi 'gyur ro //

analyzed: sarba zhes pa'i bram ze zhig ste de'i ched du /
