original: /'o na aaka'i rkyen'ang sarba'i ming can no zhes pas na sarba'i ming can smos pa kho nas de dgag pa grub po zhes pas gzhan smos pas ci bya /
analyzed: /'o na aaka'i rkyen'ang sarba'i ming can no zhes pas na sarba'i ming can smos pa kho nas de dgag pa grub po zhes pas gzhan smos pas ci bya /
translated: But since the condition of ak is also called sarva, the mere mention of sarva would suffice to negate it. What is the use of mentioning anything else?

original: ma shes pa la sogs pa'i don 'ang de'i rab tu sbyor ba po ste ming thams cad pa 'ba' zhig ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ma shes pa la sogs pa'i don 'ang de'i rab tu sbyor ba po ste ming thams cad pa 'ba' zhig ni ma yin no //
translated: The meaning of “not knowing” and so on is the one who applies it, not just any sarva.

original: de ji ltar sarba'i ming can smos pas de 'gog par rigs she na /
analyzed: de ji ltar sarba'i ming can smos pas de 'gog par rigs she na /
translated: How is it reasonable to negate that by mentioning sarva?

original: 'di yang dag pha ma yin te /🔽gang zhig gnyis dag la 'gyur zhing thob pa de ni gang yang rung bas nye bar 'dogs te dper na ma'i bu /
analyzed: 'di yang dag pha ma yin te / gang zhig gnyis dag la 'gyur zhing thob pa de ni gang yang rung bas nye bar 'dogs te dper na ma'i bu /
translated: This is not correct.

original: pha'i bu zhes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: pha'i bu zhes pa bzhin no //
translated: That which occurs in two ways and is obtained is designated by either one, just as in the expressions “the son of the mother” and “the son of the father.”

original: de'i phyir aa ka'i rkyen ni sarba'i ming can kho na'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir aa ka'i rkyen ni sarba'i ming can kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, the condition of ak is only called sarva.

original: 'di'i skabs su byas pa'i bya ba sarba'i ming can smos pas 'gog gi skabs gzhan du byas pa'i aaka'i rkyen ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'di'i skabs su byas pa'i bya ba sarba'i ming can smos pas 'gog gi skabs gzhan du byas pa'i aaka'i rkyen ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: In this context, the negation is made by mentioning sarva, which is the one that is used, not by mentioning ak, which is used in another context.

original: 'di'ang yang dag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di'ang yang dag pa ma yin te /
translated: This is also not correct.

original: de ltar gyur na sarba'i ming can smos pa don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar gyur na sarba'i ming can smos pa don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, then the mention of the one having the name sarva would be meaningless.🔽Therefore, the refutation of the ak affix from the mention of the one having the name sarva is established.

original: de'i phyir sarba ming can smos pa las aaka'i rkyen dgag pa grub po zhes pas gzhan smos pa don med pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir sarba ming can smos pa las aaka'i rkyen dgag pa grub po zhes pas gzhan smos pa don med pa ste /
translated: Thus, the mention of the other is meaningless.

original: de ltar yin na de'i tshe 'di'i dgos pa bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar yin na de'i tshe 'di'i dgos pa bsam par bya'o //
translated: If that were so, then at that time one should think of its purpose.

original: gsum pa'i tshig sdud la'ang ngo //
analyzed: gsum pa'i tshig sdud la'ang ngo //
translated: Also, the third case is contracted.

original: gsum pa'i tshig sdud yod na thams cad pa'i ming las pha rol rkyen las sarba'i ming can gyi bya bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gsum pa'i tshig sdud yod na thams cad pa'i ming las pha rol rkyen las sarba'i ming can gyi bya bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: If the third case is contracted, then from the name of the all, the action of the one having the name sarva is not from the other, the affix.🔽One month earlier:

original: zla ba gcig gis snga ba ni /
analyzed: zla ba gcig gis snga ba ni /
translated: māsa pūrvaḥ

original: m'a sa p'urba:/ de'i ched du ni /
analyzed: m'a sa p'urba:/ de'i ched du ni /
translated: For that purpose:

original: m'a sa p'urba ra ya /🔽m'a sa p'urbat\/ m'a sa p'u rbe /
analyzed: m'a sa p'urba ra ya / m'a sa p'urbat\/ m'a sa p'u rbe /
translated: māsa pūrva raya🔽māsa pūrvat/🔽māsa pūrvve🔽māsa pūrvaṇām

original: m'a sa p'urb'a n'am /
analyzed: m'a sa p'urb'a n'am /
translated: māsa pūrvaḥ

original: m'a sa p'urb'a: dag la yang mi 'dod de /🔽m'a se na p'urba ya /
analyzed: m'a sa p'urb'a: dag la yang mi 'dod de / m'a se na p'urba ya /
translated: Also, māsenā pūrva ya

original: gsum pa smos pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: gsum pa smos pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is the third case?🔽That which is great and also earlier:

original: chen po'ang 'di yin la snga ma'ang yin pa ni /🔽ma h'a p'urba te /
analyzed: chen po'ang 'di yin la snga ma'ang yin pa ni / ma h'a p'urba te /
translated: mahā pūrva te

original: de'i ched du ni /
analyzed: de'i ched du ni /
translated: For that purpose:

original: m'a h'a p'urba smee /
analyzed: m'a h'a p'urba smee /
translated: mahā pūrva sme

original: 'bru mang po pa la'ang ngo //
analyzed: 'bru mang po pa la'ang ngo //
translated: The same applies to the word bahu, many.

original: 'bru mang po pa'i tshig sdad yod na thams cad pa'i ming can las pha rol gyi rkyen las sarba'i ming can gyi bya bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bru mang po pa'i tshig sdad yod na thams cad pa'i ming can las pha rol gyi rkyen las sarba'i ming can gyi bya bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If the word bahu were to be declined, the action of the word sarva, all, would not be formed from the affix of the other side of the word sarva, all.🔽That which is dear to all is sarva, all. For the sake of that,

original: gang gi dga' ba thams cad yin pa de ni thams cad yin pa de ni thams cad dga' ba ste de'i ched du ni /🔽pri ya sarb'a ya /
analyzed: gang gi dga' ba thams cad yin pa de ni thams cad yin pa de ni thams cad dga' ba ste de'i ched du ni / pri ya sarb'a ya /
translated: priyasarvāya,🔽priyasarvat,

original: pri ya sarb'at /🔽bri ya sarbe /
analyzed: pri ya sarb'at / bri ya sarbe /
translated: priyasarve,🔽priyasarvāṇām,

original: pri ya sarb'a n'am /
analyzed: pri ya sarb'a n'am /
translated: priyasarvāḥ.

original: pri ya sarb'a:/ phyogs rnams kyi yang na'o //
analyzed: pri ya sarb'a:/ phyogs rnams kyi yang na'o //
translated: The word bahu is also used for the directions.

original: phyogs brjod pa'i sgra rnams kyi 'bru mang po pa gang yin pa de yod pa la thams cad pa'i ming las pha rol gyi rkyen la sarba'i ming can gyi bya ba yang na mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyogs brjod pa'i sgra rnams kyi 'bru mang po pa gang yin pa de yod pa la thams cad pa'i ming las pha rol gyi rkyen la sarba'i ming can gyi bya ba yang na mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If the word bahu were to be declined in the expression of the directions, the action of the word sarva, all, would not be formed from the affix of the other side of the word sarva, all.

original: lho dang shar gyi bar gang yin pa'i phyir bral de ni lho shar te @93a * //
analyzed: lho dang shar gyi bar gang yin pa'i phyir bral de ni lho shar te @93a * //
translated: Dakṣiṇapūrvā is the direction that is both south and east.

original: de'i ched du ni /🔽dakshi na p'urba syee /🔽dakshi na p'urba yee /
analyzed: de'i ched du ni / dakshi na p'urba syee / dakshi na p'urba yee /
translated: For the sake of that,🔽dakṣiṇapūrvāya,🔽dakṣiṇapūrvaye,

original: dakshi na p'urba sy'a:/
analyzed: dakshi na p'urba sy'a:/
translated: dakṣiṇapūrvāyaḥ.

original: dakshi na p'urba y'a /🔽dakshi na p'urba sy'am:/
analyzed: dakshi na p'urba y'a / dakshi na p'urba sy'am:/
translated: Dakṣiṇāpūrva.🔽Dakṣiṇāpūrvasyāṃ.

original: dakshi na p'urb'a y'am /
analyzed: dakshi na p'urb'a y'am /
translated: Dakṣiṇāpūrve.

original: sarba'i ming can gyi bya ba'i phyogs la ni /
analyzed: sarba'i ming can gyi bya ba'i phyogs la ni /
translated: In the case of the names of the directions,

original: su dang bcas pa rnams te zhes pas thung ngu dang su yig a'a ga ma dag go //
analyzed: su dang bcas pa rnams te zhes pas thung ngu dang su yig a'a ga ma dag go //
translated: those that have su are short and those that have su are long.

original: skyes par bshad pa can gyi skyes pa can ni skyes pa bzhin no zhes sbyor ba 'thad pa las dakshi na'i sgra skyes pa dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: skyes par bshad pa can gyi skyes pa can ni skyes pa bzhin no zhes sbyor ba 'thad pa las dakshi na'i sgra skyes pa dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: The one that has the meaning of “born” is like the one that has the meaning of “born.” The word dakṣiṇa is like the one that has the meaning of “born.”

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: In the same way,

original: autta ra p'urba syee /
analyzed: autta ra p'urba syee /
translated: Uttarāpūrva.

original: autta ra p'urb'a ya zhes pa la sogs pa rnams su'o //
analyzed: autta ra p'urb'a ya zhes pa la sogs pa rnams su'o //
translated: Uttarāpūrve, and so on.

original: mdzes ma gang gi shar ma byang yin pa de ni p'urbotta r'a /
analyzed: mdzes ma gang gi shar ma byang yin pa de ni p'urbotta r'a /
translated: The one whose east is north is Uttarāpūrva.

original: de'i ched du ni p'urbotta r'a ye shes pa 'di ci'i phyir mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i ched du ni p'urbotta r'a ye shes pa 'di ci'i phyir mi 'gyur te /
translated: Why would this not be for that purpose?

original: gal te tshig gnyis zhes pa 'dis 'bras bu mang po pa yin pas so zhe na /
analyzed: gal te tshig gnyis zhes pa 'dis 'bras bu mang po pa yin pas so zhe na /
translated: If it is said that this is because it is a plural of the result,

original: 'dir brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir brjod par bya ste /
translated: it should be said here.

original: phyogs rnams kyi dngos gang yin pa phyogs bral ba de bzhin no zhes pa 'di 'bru mang po pa ste /
analyzed: phyogs rnams kyi dngos gang yin pa phyogs bral ba de bzhin no zhes pa 'di 'bru mang po pa ste /
translated: The term “just like” is a particle.

original: de la rnams par brtag pa 'di yin gyi gal te tshig gnyis pa zhes pa 'dir na mi yin te btags pa dang dngos dag las dngos la yid ches pa'o zhes pa'i tshig las so //
analyzed: de la rnams par brtag pa 'di yin gyi gal te tshig gnyis pa zhes pa 'dir na mi yin te btags pa dang dngos dag las dngos la yid ches pa'o zhes pa'i tshig las so //
translated: The analysis here is as follows: If the second term is a particle, then it is not a particle, because it is a particle and a thing, and a thing is more credible than a particle.🔽If the second term is a particle, then “just like” is a thing, and if “just like” is a thing, then “just like” is a particle.

original: phyogs bral de bzhin no zhes pa 'di dngos dang / gal te tshig gnyis zhes pa 'di btags pa'o zhes pa de ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: phyogs bral de bzhin no zhes pa 'di dngos dang / gal te tshig gnyis zhes pa 'di btags pa'o zhes pa de ci ltar zhe na /
translated: If you ask, “How is that?”

original: smras pa phyogs bral de bzhin no zhes pa 'di phyogs bral brjod par bya ba ma byas pa ste /
analyzed: smras pa phyogs bral de bzhin no zhes pa 'di phyogs bral brjod par bya ba ma byas pa ste /
translated: The term “just like” is not used to express the absence of a position.

original: de'ang phyogs brjod pa'i sgra rnams kho nas bsgrub par bya'o zhes pas phyogs rdzod par byed pa'i phyir phyogs bral de bzhin no zhes pa 'bru mang po ba ste de dngos so //
analyzed: de'ang phyogs brjod pa'i sgra rnams kho nas bsgrub par bya'o zhes pas phyogs rdzod par byed pa'i phyir phyogs bral de bzhin no zhes pa 'bru mang po ba ste de dngos so //
translated: It is used to establish the absence of a position, because it is used to express a position. Therefore, “just like” is a particle, and it is a thing.

original: cig shos ni tshig gzhan gyi don tsam la bsgrub par bya bzhin pa phyogs brjod par yang 'gyur ba ci ltar dngos yin /
analyzed: cig shos ni tshig gzhan gyi don tsam la bsgrub par bya bzhin pa phyogs brjod par yang 'gyur ba ci ltar dngos yin /
translated: The other is the mere meaning of another word, and it is also said to be the subject.🔽Therefore,

original: de'i phyir / p'urbotta r'a yee /
analyzed: de'i phyir / p'urbotta r'a yee /
translated: purvottare

original: str'i yee zhes pa 'dir btags pa ba nyid kyi phyir 'bru mang po pa'i don la rnam par brtag pa med do //
analyzed: str'i yee zhes pa 'dir btags pa ba nyid kyi phyir 'bru mang po pa'i don la rnam par brtag pa med do //
translated: Here, because of the suffix itself, there is no consideration of the meaning of the plural.

original: shraddh'a las si dbyi'o //
analyzed: shraddh'a las si dbyi'o //
translated: śraddhālasidvi

original: shraddh'a'i ming can gyi rtags las phyi ma si dbyi ba 'thob po /🔽gam g'a / y'a /
analyzed: shraddh'a'i ming can gyi rtags las phyi ma si dbyi ba 'thob po / gam g'a / y'a /
translated: From the sign called śraddhā, the following sidvi is obtained.🔽gamaṅga🔽yā🔽sā

original: s'a / k'a /
analyzed: s'a / k'a /
translated: kā🔽śraddhālas

original: shraddh'a las zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: shraddh'a las zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is this called śraddhālas?🔽kilālapas

original: ki l'a la p'a: si zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: ki l'a la p'a: si zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is this called kilālapas?

original: m'a l'a: dzas\ so //🔽t'a aos\ dag la ai'o //
analyzed: m'a l'a: dzas\ so // t'a aos\ dag la ai'o //
translated: mālasjas🔽tāos

original: shraddh'a'i t'a aos\ zhes pa 'di dag phyi ma la ae nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shraddh'a'i t'a aos\ zhes pa 'di dag phyi ma la ae nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: These called śraddhātasāos become ai in the following.

original: au ma y'a /
analyzed: au ma y'a /
translated: umāyā🔽khatvāyoḥ🔽śraddhālas

original: kha tva yo:/ shraddh'a las zhes pa ci zhe na /🔽ki l'a la p'a /
analyzed: kha tva yo:/ shraddh'a las zhes pa ci zhe na / ki l'a la p'a /
translated: What is this called śraddhālas?🔽kilālapas

original: ki la la po:/
analyzed: ki la la po:/
translated: kilālapas

original: t'a aos te byings kyi a'a ni @93b ghut ma yin pa'i dbyangs la zhes aas a'a dbyi'o //
analyzed: t'a aos te byings kyi a'a ni @93b ghut ma yin pa'i dbyangs la zhes aas a'a dbyi'o //
translated: The ā of the root is a vowel other than a, and the a is lengthened by the a.

original: sambuddhi la'ang ngo //
analyzed: sambuddhi la'ang ngo //
translated: And also in sambuddhi.

original: shraddh'a'i sam buddhi pha rol la ae nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shraddh'a'i sam buddhi pha rol la ae nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: In śraddhā, sambuddhi, the ā becomes e with respect to the other.

original: he gam ge /
analyzed: he gam ge /
translated: He agam ge.

original: sam buddhi rnams la zhes brjod par bya la sbyor ba 'thad pa ni phyi ma'i don du'o //
analyzed: sam buddhi rnams la zhes brjod par bya la sbyor ba 'thad pa ni phyi ma'i don du'o //
translated: The a should be stated with respect to sambuddhi, and the application is appropriate for the latter meaning.

original: ma'i don rnams kyi thung ngu'o //
analyzed: ma'i don rnams kyi thung ngu'o //
translated: The short ones of the meanings of ma.

original: ma'i don te gang zhig ma rjod par byed pa'i shraddh'a'i ming can de rnams thung ngur 'gyur te sam buddhi pha rol la'o //
analyzed: ma'i don te gang zhig ma rjod par byed pa'i shraddh'a'i ming can de rnams thung ngur 'gyur te sam buddhi pha rol la'o //
translated: The meanings of ma, those that are not stated, those that have the name śraddhā, they become short, with respect to sambuddhi.

original: he aampa / he aenta /
analyzed: he aampa / he aenta /
translated: He aṃ he aṃte.

original: ye aakka / ae'o zhes brjod par bya ba la thung ngu smos pa ni ming sngon ma can gyi sgrub pa ni mi rtag pa'o zhes pas thung ngu nyid mi rtag pa nyid kyi don te des na 'dir mi 'gyur ro //🔽he aamb'a de /🔽he aanta le /
analyzed: ye aakka / ae'o zhes brjod par bya ba la thung ngu smos pa ni ming sngon ma can gyi sgrub pa ni mi rtag pa'o zhes pas thung ngu nyid mi rtag pa nyid kyi don te des na 'dir mi 'gyur ro // he aamb'a de / he aanta le /
translated: Ye akā e o should be stated. The mention of short is for the sake of the permanence of the derivation of the former name. Therefore, short itself is the meaning of permanence. By that, it does not occur here.🔽He aṃbāde.🔽He aṃtale.

original: he aambi ke /
analyzed: he aambi ke /
translated: He aṃbike.

original: aoo a'i'o // shraddh'a las pha rol gyi ao yig a'i nyid du 'thob po //
analyzed: aoo a'i'o // shraddh'a las pha rol gyi ao yig a'i nyid du 'thob po //
translated: From the syllable of faith, the syllable of the other side is obtained as the nature of A.

original: au m'a gam ge //
analyzed: au m'a gam ge //
translated: U, MA, GAM, GHA.

original: tish'a ta: m'a le a'a na ya /
analyzed: tish'a ta: m'a le a'a na ya /
translated: TI, SHA, MA, LA, YA, NA.

original: ring por brjod pa ni sna tshogs pa'i don no //
analyzed: ring por brjod pa ni sna tshogs pa'i don no //
translated: The long one is expressed as the meaning of various.

original: nga ldan rnams yee ya'as\ y'as\ y'ama\'o //
analyzed: nga ldan rnams yee ya'as\ y'as\ y'ama\'o //
translated: The possessives are YE, YAS, YAM.

original: nga ldan rnams zhes pa rdzas kyi mtha' can no //
analyzed: nga ldan rnams zhes pa rdzas kyi mtha' can no //
translated: The possessives are the end of the substance.

original: yee y'as\ y'as\ y'am\ zhes pa rdzas\ phyis pa'o //
analyzed: yee y'as\ y'as\ y'am\ zhes pa rdzas\ phyis pa'o //
translated: YE, YAS, YAM is the substance later.

original: tshig gang rnam la yod pa de rnams nga ldan no //🔽shraddh'a las phyi ma'i nga ldan gyi brjod pa nge dang nga si dang ngas dang ngi zhes pa 'di rnams grangs ji lta ba bzhin du //
analyzed: tshig gang rnam la yod pa de rnams nga ldan no // shraddh'a las phyi ma'i nga ldan gyi brjod pa nge dang nga si dang ngas dang ngi zhes pa 'di rnams grangs ji lta ba bzhin du //
translated: The words that exist in the case endings are the possessives.🔽From the syllable of faith, the expression of the later possessives, YE, YAS, YAM, these are changed according to the number.🔽As YE, YAS, YAM.

original: yee dang y'as\ y'as\ y'am\ zhes pa 'di rnams su bsgyur par 'gyur ro //🔽au m'a yee /
analyzed: yee dang y'as\ y'as\ y'am\ zhes pa 'di rnams su bsgyur par 'gyur ro // au m'a yee /
translated: U, MA, YE.

original: au m'a y'a: au m'a y'a:/
analyzed: au m'a y'a: au m'a y'a:/
translated: U, MA, YAS, U, MA, YAS, U, MA, YAM.

original: au m'a y'am\/ thams cad pa'i ming las ni su dang bcas pa rnams te snga ma rnams thung ngu'o //
analyzed: au m'a y'am\/ thams cad pa'i ming las ni su dang bcas pa rnams te snga ma rnams thung ngu'o //
translated: From all the names, those with SU are the former short ones.

analyzed: gsal byed mtha'i rtags las phyi ma'i si dbyi ba 'thob po //

analyzed: des na sbyor bas ni bya zhe na'di ni yang dag pa ma yin te /

analyzed: aagni las phyi ma'i aoo yig ni snga ma'i yi ger 'gyur ro //

original: buddh'i / dhe n'u /
analyzed: buddh'i / dhe n'u /

analyzed: aagm'i las phyi ma'i t'a'i rkyen n'a ru 'gyur ba 'thob ste bud med ma yin pa la'o //

analyzed: aagn'i n'a / bh'a nu n'a /

analyzed: bud med ma yin pa la zhes pa ci zhe na /

original: bh'uddy'a / dhe nv'a /
analyzed: bh'uddy'a / dhe nv'a /

original: aa das\'i aa mu'ang ngo //
analyzed: aa das\'i aa mu'ang ngo //

original: t'a zhes pa rjes su 'jug ste /
analyzed: t'a zhes pa rjes su 'jug ste /

original: aa mu n'a //
analyzed: aa mu n'a //

analyzed: bud me ma yin pa la zhes pa ci zhe na /

analyzed: aa mu y'a /

analyzed: aa das\ la t'a'o //

analyzed: tyad la sogs pa'i aa nyid do //

analyzed: bud med la aa las aapa\'o //

analyzed: ma las au nyid do zhes pas au nyid do //

analyzed: ai aet au aot\ dzas\ la'o //

analyzed: ai aeta\du 'gyur zhing au aot du 'gyur ro //

analyzed: dzas\ phyi ma la'o //

original: pa ta ya:/ pat wa:/
analyzed: pa ta ya:/ pat wa:/

analyzed: buddha ya:/ dhe na wa:/

analyzed: sam buddhi la'ang ngo //

analyzed: he sa ke /

analyzed: he na d'i dang he badh'u zhes pa 'dir mi 'gyur te 'thung ngu sgrub pa'i shugs las so //

analyzed: de la'o // ai aet 'gyur zhing au aota\ du 'gyur te de'i rkyen phyi ma la'o //

analyzed: nga si ngas dag gi aa dbyi ba'ang ngo //

analyzed: nga si ngas dag phyi ma la ai aeta\ du 'gyur zhing au aota\ du 'gyur te de dag gi aa yig dbyi ba'ang ngo //

analyzed: aagne:/ aagne:/ dhe no:/

analyzed: aagni las phyi ma'i ngi de snga ma'i yi ge dang lan cig aoo nyid du 'thob bo //

analyzed: bu dadhoo / dhe noo /

analyzed: ngi'i too zhes byas na bam shi too zhes pa mi 'grub ste /

analyzed: bam shi ti'i ti'o zhes pa 'dis ti'i sgra phyis pa ni bam shoo zhes par 'gyur bas so //

analyzed: snga ma dang bcas pa zhes pa ldog ste /

analyzed: sa khi dang pa ti dang 'brel pa can gyi ni gang yin de aoo nyid du 'gyur ro //

original: sa khyoo // pa tyoo /
analyzed: sa khyoo // pa tyoo /

original: nga si ngas dag gi aa au'o //
analyzed: nga si ngas dag gi aa au'o //
translated: The ā of ṅsa and ṅgha is ō.

original: sa khi pa ti dag gi ngi ngas gang yin pa de dag gi aa yig au nyid du 'thob bo //
analyzed: sa khi pa ti dag gi ngi ngas gang yin pa de dag gi aa yig au nyid du 'thob bo //
translated: The ṅ of sakhi and patī becomes the ā of the letter ō.

original: sa khyu:/ sa khyu:/
analyzed: sa khyu:/ sa khyu:/
translated: sakhyau, sakhyāḥ, sakhyah.

original: grangs ji lta ba bzhin du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: grangs ji lta ba bzhin du mi 'gyur te /
translated: It does not change according to the number.

original: sa khi'i 'ang ngo zhes pa'i shes par byed pa las so //
analyzed: sa khi'i 'ang ngo zhes pa'i shes par byed pa las so //
translated: From the indicating of the Sāketa [grammar].

original: r'it\ mtha' las snga ma dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: r'it\ mtha' las snga ma dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The sign of the final ri is together with the preceding [vowel].

original: ri yig mtha' can gyi rtags las pha rol gyi nga si ngas dag gis aa yig snga ma'i dbyangs dang lhan cig au nyid du 'thob bo //
analyzed: ri yig mtha' can gyi rtags las pha rol gyi nga si ngas dag gis aa yig snga ma'i dbyangs dang lhan cig au nyid du 'thob bo //
translated: From the sign of the final ri [comes] au itself together with the vowel of the preceding a by the as and as of the other [side].

original: be tu:/ bi tu:/
analyzed: be tu:/ bi tu:/
translated: vetuḥ, vituḥ.

original: ta pha rol tu byed pa ni the tshom med pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: ta pha rol tu byed pa ni the tshom med pa'i don du'o //
translated: The par [in paribhāṣā] means without doubt.

original: ai la a'a ste si dbyi ba 'ang ngo //
analyzed: ai la a'a ste si dbyi ba 'ang ngo //
translated: The i becomes ā and the s is elided.

original: rit\ mtha'i rtags si la ste si yig phyi ma la mtha' a'a nyid du 'gyur zhing si'ang dbyi'o //
analyzed: rit\ mtha'i rtags si la ste si yig phyi ma la mtha' a'a nyid du 'gyur zhing si'ang dbyi'o //
translated: The sign of the final ri is s, and the final ā becomes s itself and the s is elided.

original: gang thob pa la sgrub pa brtsams pa ni de la gnod byed du 'gyur ro zhes pas bsgyur ba 'dis aar\ dang a'ar dag 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: gang thob pa la sgrub pa brtsams pa ni de la gnod byed du 'gyur ro zhes pas bsgyur ba 'dis aar\ dang a'ar dag 'gog pa'o //
translated: The one who begins to practice what is obtained is harmed by that. By this translation, the ar and āḥ are refuted.

original: pi t'a / kart'a / bida 'o zhes ma byas te sna tshogs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: pi t'a / kart'a / bida 'o zhes ma byas te sna tshogs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: pitā, kartā, viduḥ. It is not done like this, because of the variety.

original: shas\ la aa aagni bzhin no //
analyzed: shas\ la aa aagni bzhin no //
translated: In śaśa, it is like agni.

original: aangni bzhin ni aagni dang mtshungs pa'o //
analyzed: aangni bzhin ni aagni dang mtshungs pa'o //
translated: The agni is like agni.🔽

original: rit mtha'i rtags shas phyi ma la aagni bzhin du 'gyur te /
analyzed: rit mtha'i rtags shas phyi ma la aagni bzhin du 'gyur te /
translated: The final letter of the sign becomes ar, like agni.

original: aagni las phyi ma'i shas\ la gang bshad pa de ri yig mtha' las kyang 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: aagni las phyi ma'i shas\ la gang bshad pa de ri yig mtha' las kyang 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that whatever is explained from the latter part of agni also applies to the letter ri at the end.🔽potrin/

original: po trin\/ bhr'i tr'in\/
analyzed: po trin\/ bhr'i tr'in\/
translated: bhartrin/

original: bud med la na nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: bud med la na nyid du mi 'gyur te /
translated: It does not become na in the feminine.

original: sva sr'i: ngi la aara'o //
analyzed: sva sr'i: ngi la aara'o //
translated: svasri/

original: rit mtha' las snga ma dang bcas pa'o zhes pa 'di la ri yig tsam la ltos pa'o //
analyzed: rit mtha' las snga ma dang bcas pa'o zhes pa 'di la ri yig tsam la ltos pa'o //
translated: The meaning is that this is dependent on just the letter ri.

original: rtags kyi mtha' ri yig gang yin pa de aar du 'gyur te /
analyzed: rtags kyi mtha' ri yig gang yin pa de aar du 'gyur te /
translated: The final letter of the sign, whatever it is, becomes ar.

original: ngi la ste ngi'i rkyen phyi ma la'o //
analyzed: ngi la ste ngi'i rkyen phyi ma la'o //
translated: In the latter condition of i,

original: pi ta ri /
analyzed: pi ta ri /
translated: pitari/

original: m'a ta ri /
analyzed: m'a ta ri /
translated: matari/

original: ngi la zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: ngi la zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is the i?

original: m'a tre / ghut la'ang ngo //
analyzed: m'a tre / ghut la'ang ngo //
translated: matre/

original: rtags mtha'i ri yig ghut pha rol la aar du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtags mtha'i ri yig ghut pha rol la aar du 'gyur ro //
translated: The final letter of the sign becomes ar in the latter part of ghu.

original: pi ta roo /🔽pi ta ra:/ m'a ta ram /
analyzed: pi ta roo / pi ta ra:/ m'a ta ram /
translated: pitaro/🔽pitaraḥ/🔽mataram/

original: m'a ta roo /
analyzed: m'a ta roo /
translated: mataraḥ/

original: di dang ghut dag la aara\'o zhes brjod @95b par bya ba la sbyor ba 'thad pa ni phyi ma'i don no //
analyzed: di dang ghut dag la aara\'o zhes brjod @95b par bya ba la sbyor ba 'thad pa ni phyi ma'i don no //
translated: The meaning of the latter is that it is correct to apply the statement “ar, ar” to di and ghu.

original: byings las tri sgra'i a'ara'o //
analyzed: byings las tri sgra'i a'ara'o //
translated: The root TRI, with the augment AR.

original: tri'ang 'di yin la sgra yang yin pa ni tri sgra'o //
analyzed: tri'ang 'di yin la sgra yang yin pa ni tri sgra'o //
translated: TRI is this, and also a sound is TRI-sound.

original: byings las pha rol gyi gri sgra'i ri yig gang yin pa de a'ar\ du 'gyur te /
analyzed: byings las pha rol gyi gri sgra'i ri yig gang yin pa de a'ar\ du 'gyur te /
translated: The RI of the root PARI, with the augment AR, becomes AR.

original: ghut pha rol la'o //
analyzed: ghut pha rol la'o //
translated: GHAUT is for the other side.

original: aar\ 'gog pa'o //🔽kart'a roo // kart'a ra:/
analyzed: aar\ 'gog pa'o // kart'a roo // kart'a ra:/
translated: AR is for stopping.🔽KARTAROH, KARTARAH.

original: w'akt'a roo / w'akt'a ra:/
analyzed: w'akt'a roo / w'akt'a ra:/
translated: VAKTAROH, VAKTARAH.

original: du kri nya byed pa la'o //
analyzed: du kri nya byed pa la'o //
translated: DUKRITYA is for making.

original: wa tsa brjod pa la'o //
analyzed: wa tsa brjod pa la'o //
translated: VAK is for speaking.

original: wu na\ tri tsa dag go zhes pas tri tsa'o //
analyzed: wu na\ tri tsa dag go zhes pas tri tsa'o //
translated: VUN is for TRI and CA, therefore TRIC.

original: yon tan no //
analyzed: yon tan no //
translated: It is a quality.

original: tsa sde'i ki'o //
analyzed: tsa sde'i ki'o //
translated: The KI of the CA group.

original: byings las zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: byings las zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is meant by “from the root”?

original: aa t'a roo /
analyzed: aa t'a roo /
translated: ATAROHA.

original: ya t'i 'bad pa la'o //
analyzed: ya t'i 'bad pa la'o //
translated: YATI is for striving.

original: ya ti las 'phel pa'ang ngo zhes pas dana'i rkyen te aa yig gi 'phel ba a'a yig go //
analyzed: ya ti las 'phel pa'ang ngo zhes pas dana'i rkyen te aa yig gi 'phel ba a'a yig go //
translated: YATI has an augment, therefore DIN.

original: 'di tri sgrar 'gyur mod byings las pha rol ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di tri sgrar 'gyur mod byings las pha rol ni ma yin no //
translated: This becomes TRI-sound, but it is not from the root.

original: tri sgra'i zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: tri sgra'i zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is meant by “of the TRI-sound”?

original: na roo:/ na ra:/
analyzed: na roo:/ na ra:/
translated: NAROH, NARAH.

original: n'iny thob pa la'o //
analyzed: n'iny thob pa la'o //
translated: NAU is for obtaining.

original: na ya ti las di'ang ngo zhes pas dina'o //
analyzed: na ya ti las di'ang ngo zhes pas dina'o //
translated: NAYA has a DI, therefore DINI.

original: de ni ti'ang ngo zhes brjod pa las da rjes su 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: de ni ti'ang ngo zhes brjod pa las da rjes su 'brel pa'o //
translated: It is a suffix.

original: des na da rjes su 'brel pa la mtha'i dbyangs la sogs pa dbyi 'o //
analyzed: des na da rjes su 'brel pa la mtha'i dbyangs la sogs pa dbyi 'o //
translated: Therefore, the final vowel, etc. of a suffix is elided.

original: sgra smos pa ni rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i don no //
analyzed: sgra smos pa ni rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i don no //
translated: The mention of “sound” is for the sake of various meanings.

original: sva sri la sogs pa rnams kyi'ang ngo //
analyzed: sva sri la sogs pa rnams kyi'ang ngo //
translated: It is also of sva, sri, etc.

original: sva sri zhes pa la sogs pa rnams ghut phyi ma la w'ar\ du 'gyur ro //🔽sva s'a roo:/ napt'a roo /
analyzed: sva sri zhes pa la sogs pa rnams ghut phyi ma la w'ar\ du 'gyur ro // sva s'a roo:/ napt'a roo /
translated: Sva, sri, etc. become vā when followed by a gutturals.🔽Sva, saroḥ, naptraroḥ,

original: napt'a ra:/ sva sri nipti neshtr\i dang / tvashtri kshatti /
analyzed: napt'a ra:/ sva sri nipti neshtr\i dang / tvashtri kshatti /
translated: naptrari, svāmin, niṣṭhātṛ, tvaṣṭṛ,

original: de bzhin du'ang /
analyzed: de bzhin du'ang /
translated: kṣattṛ,

original: ho tri po tri pra shasti /
analyzed: ho tri po tri pra shasti /
translated: hotrī, potrī, praśastī,

original: brgyad rnams sva sri sogs bshad /
analyzed: brgyad rnams sva sri sogs bshad /
translated: the eight are explained as sva, sri, etc.

original: 'o nan ptri la sogs pa rnams tri'i rkyen gyi mtha' can no zhes pas de rnams kyi bsgyur bsnga mas grub ste /
analyzed: 'o nan ptri la sogs pa rnams tri'i rkyen gyi mtha' can no zhes pas de rnams kyi bsgyur bsnga mas grub ste /
translated: Then, since nan, patrī, etc. have the final of the instrumental case, they are established by the previous change.

original: de'i phyir sva sr'i 'o zhes pa mdor bya ba la sogs pa smos pas ci zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir sva sr'i 'o zhes pa mdor bya ba la sogs pa smos pas ci zhe na /
translated: Therefore, what is the use of mentioning sva, sārī, etc. in the summary?

original: bden te grub par gyur pa la rtsom pa ni nges pa'i don du'o zhes pas naptri la sogs pa rnams nges pa'i don du nye bar blangs pa'o //
analyzed: bden te grub par gyur pa la rtsom pa ni nges pa'i don du'o zhes pas naptri la sogs pa rnams nges pa'i don du nye bar blangs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the na, pa, ta, etc., are taken in the definitive meaning.

original: aun la sogs pa'i rkyen gyi mtha' can rnams gang gi tshe snga mas a'ar du bsgyur ba de'i tshe naptri la sogs pa rnams bdun po kho na ste /
analyzed: aun la sogs pa'i rkyen gyi mtha' can rnams gang gi tshe snga mas a'ar du bsgyur ba de'i tshe naptri la sogs pa rnams bdun po kho na ste /
translated: When the na, etc., which have the suffix of the un, etc., are changed to ar by the preceding one, then the na, pa, ta, etc., are only the seven,

original: gzhan rnams ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan rnams ma yin no //
translated: and not the others.

original: des na 'dir mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na 'dir mi 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, it is not so here:

original: pi ta roo:/ sambuddhi la a'a 'ang ma yin no ;
analyzed: pi ta roo:/ sambuddhi la a'a 'ang ma yin no ;
translated: pitaraḥ, sambuddhaḥ.

original: / ritra mtha'i sam buddhi phyi ma la aar du bsgyur ba dang a'a nyid kyang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: / ritra mtha'i sam buddhi phyi ma la aar du bsgyur ba dang a'a nyid kyang mi 'gyur te /
translated: Nor is it so in the following sambuddhi, where the final ri is changed to ar and the a is changed to ā,

original: lhag ma yin pa'i phyir ghut la'ang ngo zhes pas aar nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lhag ma yin pa'i phyir ghut la'ang ngo zhes pas aar nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: because of being the remainder, it is ar itself.

original: he karta: he pi ta: thung ngu na d'i shraddh'a rnams las si dbyi'o //🔽sambuddhi la zhes rjes su 'jug bzhin pa ni don gyi dbang @96a * //
analyzed: he karta: he pi ta: thung ngu na d'i shraddh'a rnams las si dbyi'o // sambuddhi la zhes rjes su 'jug bzhin pa ni don gyi dbang @96a * //
translated: he, kartaḥ, he, pitā. The short i is from the nadi of śraddhā.

original: las dang po'i mtha' can du 'byung ngo //
analyzed: las dang po'i mtha' can du 'byung ngo //
translated: The following sambuddhi is in the beginning, because of the power of the meaning.

original: thung ngu'i mtha' dang na a'i ming can dang shraddh'a'i ming can gyi rtags las sambhuddhi'i si yig dbyi ba 'thob po //🔽he briksha / he na d'i //🔽he ba dh'u /🔽je gam ge / sambuddhi la zhes pa ci zhe na /🔽briksha: // na d'i smos pa ni phyi ma'i don du ste /🔽he na d'i zhes ba la la sogs pa ni thung ngur byas pa na thung ngu smos pa kho na las grub pa'i phyir ro //🔽nges par lhung ba'i yongs su bshad pas thung ngu ji ltan yin te sambuddhi'i nyams par byed do zhe na /🔽yi ge smos pa na rgyu mtshan zhes pa'i tshig las byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thung ngu'i mtha' dang na a'i ming can dang shraddh'a'i ming can gyi rtags las sambhuddhi'i si yig dbyi ba 'thob po // he briksha / he na d'i // he ba dh'u / je gam ge / sambuddhi la zhes pa ci zhe na / briksha: // na d'i smos pa ni phyi ma'i don du ste / he na d'i zhes ba la la sogs pa ni thung ngur byas pa na thung ngu smos pa kho na las grub pa'i phyir ro // nges par lhung ba'i yongs su bshad pas thung ngu ji ltan yin te sambuddhi'i nyams par byed do zhe na / yi ge smos pa na rgyu mtshan zhes pa'i tshig las byed par 'gyur ro //
